Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the finance, marketing, and product teams, your focus will be on deriving insights from the group data warehouse to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize our technology stack (Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, and Superset) to derive insights from the group data warehouse.
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and actionable insights.
Build visualizations and storytelling frameworks to present data in an engaging and understandable manner.
Understand and analyze core e-commerce KPIs to support business objectives.
Ensure data stewardship and the delivery of accurate and reliable data analysis.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



Bonus Skills / If you know some of this, even better


Experience using Python, specifically creating Airflow DAGs.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control (GIT).



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we have got you interested and you are open to taking the next step, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Berlin - up to €90,000




We are working with a growing technology company in Berlin who are making multiple hires across their data team as it continues to expand, including a Data Analyst. If you are looking to join an organisation where you can make an instant impact and work across a range of projects, this could be a great opportunity for you.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular audits and quality checks
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to drive continuous improvement




Requirements:

Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Exposure to cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data modelling techniques




The role offers an excellent opportunity to develop and progress in your career, as the company continues on their upward trajectory. The team have also created an environment where people can constantly improve and develop their skill set, making it an enjoyable place to work.




The role is playing up to €90,000 and offers hybrid working. Please reach out to find out more and apply!

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making and support the continuous improvement of our operations and services. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SQL, data modeling, and statistical analysis, with a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Independently analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights, framing problems correctly, cleaning, and interpreting data sets.
Structure complex analytical CTEs in modeling pipelines using advanced SQL techniques, including window functions.
Develop reliable and accurate analytical workflows using DBT to create analytics models.
Apply statistical and analytical methods confidently to generate insights on specific issues or domain problems.
Develop efficient tracking concepts, extend existing events and attributes, and proactively resolve tracking issues.
Manage the delivery of technical stories by collaborating with other teams and stakeholders, supporting data literacy initiatives.
Communicate findings clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, creating understandable summaries of reports.
Influence stakeholders by working on dashboards with company/department-wide impact, ensuring stakeholder engagement for realizing value.


ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for advanced data modeling, experience with DBT for creating analytics models, and familiarity with statistical analysis methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and propose relevant metrics.
Good understanding of the current domain or the ability to quickly acquire expertise and fluency in the domain.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams, sharing knowledge and supporting junior team members.
Detailed knowledge of data sources within the immediate domain and support for data literacy initiatives within the company.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role


Perform strategic data analyses with direct impact to decision making of leadership team
Help building data pipelines and data models
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reports that are effective in helping stakeholders monitor key performance indicators and easily make decisions
Serve as a point of contact for ad-hoc data questions and requests


Required

About you


Background in a STEM degree, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience with one or more scripting languages, e.g. Python or JavaScript
Good knowledge of SQL and initial experience with visualization/BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Metabase)
First experience in data analytics either through internships or a full-time position
Excellent problem solving skills and always work in a solution-oriented and detailed manner
Curious and self-driven approach, as well as the ability to extract clear objectives and requirements from broad challenges or questions
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakeholders
Fluent in German


Nice to have / big plus


Data warehousing experience with dbt
Experience with cloud services, e.g. GCP (Google Cloud Platform)
Understanding of ETL (/ELT) processes
Experience working with ambiguity in a scale-up (or scale-up-like) environment


About Us

At LANCH, we empower small gastronomy owners by giving them the tools needed to make food delivery fun again. We are building the world’s biggest virtual food court by creating high-quality delivery brands together with the megastars of our generation. LANCH is food delivery built for 2024. Backed by HV Capital, Felix Capital and a bunch of superstar angels such as the founders of FlixBus, Gorillas, Flaschenpost, Glovo, Foodspring, Foodora, Honest Food, Finleap and the most known YouTubers, rap stars and athletes of our time.

LIFE AT LANCH


A steep learning curve with a high career growth trajectory and massive ownership
Hybrid working and flexible working hours combined with a fair target salary
Offsite team events and regular get-togethers
Unique team spirit and flat hierarchies
Amazing 40 people team & highly experienced leadership team to learn from
Value-centered decision making: fast, transparent, creative and fun
Team offsites every 16 weeks to come together in-person & strengthen our relationships
Complete ownership on every level

Title: Fullstack Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission

Others might refer to this unique role as a Business-oriented Data Engineer.

Are you passionate about diving deep into data, solving complex problems with clever logic, and working independently on robust data solutions? As a Fullstack Data Analyst, you will help bex gain a 360° view of activities and developments through data, creating the foundation for data-driven company management. You will be responsible for maintaining and further developing our existing data management and handling infrastructure, ensuring its continued reliability and effectiveness.

Your Responsibilities


Maintaining and gradually improving our existing data handling, reporting structures and management reports
Setting up governance for data quality, consistency, and trust in data handling
Keeping data pipelines healthy and adding new data sources to the Data Warehouse
Owning ETL processes for data from bexOS (our production system) and connected systems (support systems like Hubspot, finway or billomat)
Owning tool stack to handle data (esp. with Google Products like Cloud Scheduler, App Scripts, Cloud Functions, Big Query, …), and setting up dynamic reports and dashboards (Google Looker Studio)
Adjusting dashboards as needed following data changes
Enabling teams to effectively use data via reporting tools in their daily work, empowering them to generate their own insights
Supporting business teams and product engineering squads in data handling, incl. providing use case and metrics-specific data sets
Managing defined KPI sets, ensuring data quality and providing documentation for such
Supporting the management team with plan/actual comparisons and the development of business cases
Gathering and structuring input and data related requests from business teams
Performing project based analysis tasks connected to company initiatives in collaboration with dedicated business teams, like operations, sales, marketing, finance or product management

Unique Aspects of the Role


You will be the sole member of the data team, which allows you to have a significant impact and take full ownership of the data infrastructure. Our plan is to staff the team over the period of 2 years with other positions.
You will closely collaborate with platform engineering and regular software developers, who focus on feature development.
You will report directly to and work closely with the VP of Platform, making this a unique position within the company.


Your profile

You are known for your cooperative and collaborative nature, always ensuring that coworkers are in the loop. You proactively seek to support and collaborate with others, not just when they are stuck, but also whenever they can lend a hand. With your humble nature and caring attitude, you foster trust and authenticity within the company.

Your ambition shines through in your constant pursuit of growth and understanding of the end results of your work. You are always open to feedback, eager to innovate, and actively share knowledge with the team.

You are straightforward in your approach, by being transparent and honest. Not only that, but you make decisions confidently, follow up diligently, and are authentic and proactive in your interactions. Furthermore, you are not afraid to address any tensions or issues directly, and take the lead in and responsibility for your actions.

Your curiosity is evident in your approach to unknowns and complexities. You see these as opportunities for growth and improvement. Your curiosity often leads you to new, innovative solutions.

Your Profile


"Getting it done" mentality, and strong communication skills
Demonstrated willingness to learn and grow
Analytical understanding and general curiosity in business performance and technical data handling
Experience with analytics, reporting, and dashboard tools, especially Google products (Google App Scripts, Google Cloud Functions, Google Looker studio, BigQuery, Looker Studio)
Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and prior work experience in connecting it via LowCode Tools like Zapier or other Google Products to facilitate simple data gathering use cases
Experience in using AI Assistance like ChatGPT or Copilot to enhance effectivity
Fluent in English, German is a plus


Technical Skills (summary)


SQL writing queries combining several datasets
Proficiency in Excel (beyond VLOOKUP)
Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and first experience in Google App Scripts
First experience with Python Code to write and manage data ETL processes
First working experience with
Google Cloud (Cloud Scheduler, Secret Manager, Cloud Functions)
Google Looker Studio
BigQuery
Low-Code tools such as Zapier

Why us?


Virtual shares in the company
Home-Office First policy, with no mandatory office presence
Entrepreneurial position with responsibility and independence
Top-notch IT equipment of your choice and work with modern tools
Time for learning and development leaves and/or trainings
Comprehensive onboarding phase and regular feedback
Open, positive entrepreneurial and team culture without egos and politics
Direct collaboration with the experienced and well-coordinated management and leadership team


About Us

bex is a digital logistics platform for the construction industry. Do you want to be part of a dynamic company that is becoming the new standard for last-mile in construction and logistics? Then come join us!

Our Company Values

Cooperative working - We work in collaboration and support each other.

Ambitious growing - We are hungry for growth and want to develop continuously.

Optimistic thinking - We focus on the solution and not on the problem.

Straightforward acting - We act and communicate directly, clearly and constructively.

At bex technologies, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for every person who works here or with us, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, size, socio-economic status, origin, age, culture, faith or religion (or lack thereof).
Show more
HTML:
Your mission

Others might refer to this unique role as a Business-oriented Data Engineer.

Are you passionate about diving deep into data, solving complex problems with clever logic, and working independently on robust data solutions? As a Fullstack Data Analyst, you will help bex gain a 360° view of activities and developments through data, creating the foundation for data-driven company management. You will be responsible for maintaining and further developing our existing data management and handling infrastructure, ensuring its continued reliability and effectiveness.

Your Responsibilities

  • Maintaining and gradually improving our existing data handling, reporting structures and management reports
  • Setting up governance for data quality, consistency, and trust in data handling
  • Keeping data pipelines healthy and adding new data sources to the Data Warehouse
    • Owning ETL processes for data from bexOS (our production system) and connected systems (support systems like Hubspot, finway or billomat)
    • Owning tool stack to handle data (esp. with Google Products like Cloud Scheduler, App Scripts, Cloud Functions, Big Query, …), and setting up dynamic reports and dashboards (Google Looker Studio)
    • Adjusting dashboards as needed following data changes
  • Enabling teams to effectively use data via reporting tools in their daily work, empowering them to generate their own insights
  • Supporting business teams and product engineering squads in data handling, incl. providing use case and metrics-specific data sets
  • Managing defined KPI sets, ensuring data quality and providing documentation for such
  • Supporting the management team with plan/actual comparisons and the development of business cases
  • Gathering and structuring input and data related requests from business teams
  • Performing project based analysis tasks connected to company initiatives in collaboration with dedicated business teams, like operations, sales, marketing, finance or product management
Unique Aspects of the Role

  • You will be the sole member of the data team, which allows you to have a significant impact and take full ownership of the data infrastructure. Our plan is to staff the team over the period of 2 years with other positions.
  • You will closely collaborate with platform engineering and regular software developers, who focus on feature development.
  • You will report directly to and work closely with the VP of Platform, making this a unique position within the company.

Your profile

You are known for your cooperative and collaborative nature, always ensuring that coworkers are in the loop. You proactively seek to support and collaborate with others, not just when they are stuck, but also whenever they can lend a hand. With your humble nature and caring attitude, you foster trust and authenticity within the company.

Your ambition shines through in your constant pursuit of growth and understanding of the end results of your work. You are always open to feedback, eager to innovate, and actively share knowledge with the team.

You are straightforward in your approach, by being transparent and honest. Not only that, but you make decisions confidently, follow up diligently, and are authentic and proactive in your interactions. Furthermore, you are not afraid to address any tensions or issues directly, and take the lead in and responsibility for your actions.

Your curiosity is evident in your approach to unknowns and complexities. You see these as opportunities for growth and improvement. Your curiosity often leads you to new, innovative solutions.

Your Profile

  • "Getting it done" mentality, and strong communication skills
  • Demonstrated willingness to learn and grow
  • Analytical understanding and general curiosity in business performance and technical data handling
  • Experience with analytics, reporting, and dashboard tools, especially Google products (Google App Scripts, Google Cloud Functions, Google Looker studio, BigQuery, Looker Studio)
  • Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and prior work experience in connecting it via LowCode Tools like Zapier or other Google Products to facilitate simple data gathering use cases
  • Experience in using AI Assistance like ChatGPT or Copilot to enhance effectivity
  • Fluent in English, German is a plus

Technical Skills (summary)

  • SQL writing queries combining several datasets
  • Proficiency in Excel (beyond VLOOKUP)
  • Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and first experience in Google App Scripts
  • First experience with Python Code to write and manage data ETL processes
  • First working experience with
    • Google Cloud (Cloud Scheduler, Secret Manager, Cloud Functions)
    • Google Looker Studio
    • BigQuery
    • Low-Code tools such as Zapier
Why us?

  • Virtual shares in the company
  • Home-Office First policy, with no mandatory office presence
  • Entrepreneurial position with responsibility and independence
  • Top-notch IT equipment of your choice and work with modern tools
  • Time for learning and development leaves and/or trainings
  • Comprehensive onboarding phase and regular feedback
  • Open, positive entrepreneurial and team culture without egos and politics
  • Direct collaboration with the experienced and well-coordinated management and leadership team

About Us

bex is a digital logistics platform for the construction industry. Do you want to be part of a dynamic company that is becoming the new standard for last-mile in construction and logistics? Then come join us!

Our Company Values

Cooperative working - We work in collaboration and support each other.

Ambitious growing - We are hungry for growth and want to develop continuously.

Optimistic thinking - We focus on the solution and not on the problem.

Straightforward acting - We act and communicate directly, clearly and constructively.

At bex technologies, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for every person who works here or with us, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, size, socio-economic status, origin, age, culture, faith or religion (or lack thereof).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data and love uncovering meaningful insights? Futurae, a leading Swiss cybersecurity company, is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic and agile team. As a Senior Data Analyst at Futurae, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and improving our internal and customer-facing dashboards and tools for data analysis. Your work will contribute to providing valuable business insights to both internal stakeholders and our customers. Join us and be part of shaping the future of cybersecurity while creating outstanding user experiences!

About Us

Futurae is a customer-centric cybersecurity company that focuses on providing seamless authentication and transaction confirmation solutions. Our innovative approach prioritizes security and usability, empowering businesses to combat online threats effectively. With our experienced and diverse team of industry leaders, we constantly strive to solve the toughest challenges in online authentication and transaction signing. Join our young, international, and fast-paced team and play a significant role in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Learn more about us at www.futurae.com.

What You'll Do


Design, build, and optimize internal and customer-facing dashboards and tools for data analysis
Analyze data to uncover meaningful insights and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with product management and technical architects to define feature specifications
Partner with product, research/design and marketing teams to define A/B testing hypotheses, success metrics, and ensure statistically sound test design
Analyze and interpret results to inform product roadmap and marketing optimization
Participate in the development cycle of our software product and follow Agile development practices
Write high-quality, maintainable code in languages such as Python, R, or SQL



Requirements


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in a cybersecurity or technology-related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for uncovering insights from complex datasets
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Metabase or Tableau
Experience with statistical analysis techniques and familiarity with machine learning concepts
Solid programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or SQL
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Understanding of data security measures and privacy regulations in relevant industries


If you are a self-driven and detail-oriented individual who loves working with data and enjoys finding insights that drive business decisions, we would love to hear from you. Join Futurae and contribute to making a significant impact on the future of cybersecurity!

Benefits

Why Futurae

Join a young, international, and fast-paced Cybersecurity company with experienced industry leaders


Futurae Stock Options
Yearly personal learning & development budget
Apple Laptop and equipment for work purposes
Ability to work remotely (European time zones only)
Work at the forefront of an inspiring, dynamic tech company in the B2B space in the area of end-user authentication and transaction confirmation
Be part of our friendly, knowledge-sharing, entrepreneurial culture and flat hierarchy, where we value open and respectful communication, collaboration and an attitude that gets things done for our customers
Work in a role that gives you responsibility and independence
Access to coaching, ongoing professional development and training, mentorship and our culture of continuous learning


Futurae is an Equal Opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

By sending your application, you allow Futurae to handle and store your data.
Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



Der Interview-Prozess


Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung



Job Details


Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell



Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Title: Climate Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Job descriptionThis call for a Climate Data Analyst is part of our initiative to broaden our roster of experts specializing in regional climate modeling and data management. We are seeking distinguished professionals who are interested in contributing their expertise on a project basis and becoming integral to our future climate resilience initiatives. The role of the Climate Data Analyst focuses on supporting and enhancing our climate and energy systems modeling projects through rigorous data analysis and application of advanced analytical techniques. Your Responsibilities

Design and manage databases specific to climate data, ensuring data integrity, quality control, and normalization


Handle large datasets and perform complex statistical analyses to support climate modeling and impact assessments
Utilize models to analyze current and future climate scenarios under various greenhouse gas emissions pathways
Support conducting risk and vulnerability assessments to understand potential impacts of climate change on various sectors such as agriculture, water resources, and urban planning
Proficiency in climate data analysis tools such as Python, R, GIS, and others relevant to data analysis and model simulation
Prepare detailed reports and scientific papers for publication in peer-reviewed journals
Document methodologies, data analysis procedures, and findings for stakeholders and policy recommendations
Communicate complex climate data and findings to a diverse audience, including technical and non-technical stakeholders to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Provide training and capacity building to project partners on climate data analysis, the use of climate modeling tools, and understanding climate risk assessments
Stay abreast of advancements in climate science and data analysis technologies. Innovate and propose new methods or tools to enhance climate analysis and modeling capabilities
Adapt methodologies and focus areas based on emerging climate issues and the evolving needs of regions or sectors being studied

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Show more

  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
  • A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
  • You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
  • Fluent in German and English



WHAT WE OFFER

  • Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
  • Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
  • We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
  • 28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
  • 10 paid child’s sick days per year
  • Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
  • Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
  • Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
  • Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
  • Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
  • Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners



Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have strong background in Data Analysis?




Do you want to apply your skills and grow within a growing market?




We've partnered with a leading supplier of modern and professional learning solutions.




You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.




Please apply if you have the following:

A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
You can record, analyze, develop solutions and master various tools for data analysis and visualization such as Mixpanel or Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills with storytelling and visualization techniques to prepare findings in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
Ideally, you have knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
You have experience with cloud-based data platforms.
You have experience in sales processes and automation and data structures (ideally in Salesforce).
You have experience in an agile environment
6+ years industry experience




Nice to have:

Good communication skills in German and English




This is an urgent position. If the above stands out to you and you feel you are right for the role, please do send in your application/ get in touch with a member of the Big Cloud team as soon as possible. Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we’re only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Environmental Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Berlin

Your tasks


Responsible for energy and water data collection and processing (Data handling towards ESG/Non-Financial Reporting)
Support in analyzing and implementing digital solutions and procedures for data collection and reporting
Train operations/other departments on new processes and tools for data collection
Coordinate with multiple departments and manage incoming energy data from all sources
Checking for completeness and performing quality checks of incoming energy data
Helping develop reports and analysis
Implementation of reporting standards (e.g., CSRD, EU taxonomy)



Your profile


A completed education in the fields of engineering, energy, environmental or economic sciences (masters)
Good analytical skills, self-starter and self-motivated
Strong MS Excel skills and good MS office knowledge
Experience with environmental data management tools would be beneficial
Previous knowledge about CSRD, EPRA, GRI and CDP reporting standards would be good
Good communication skills in both English and German



Your perspective


Interesting, varied and broad range of tasks in one of the largest real estate companies in Germany and Europe
Good atmosphere, communication culture "on a first-name basis" and a pleasant working atmosphere in an environment with flat hierarchies
Individual training for professional and personal development in our academy
Professionally equipped, in-house gym with trainers and classes
Comprehensive company health management and company pension scheme
Assistance on the commute through subsidy for the use of public transport
Modern IT equipment such as laptops and mobile phones
Mobility and flexibility using pool and company cars for the execution of tasks
Flexible working hours and mobile working for an even better work-life balance
Exciting virtual programs for childcare with our partner company Voiio Opportunity to attend Bundesliga matches of FC Union Berlin, our favorite club
Discounts at selected hotels worldwide with up to 30% on overnight stays and special conditions on food and beverages
Employee discounts for special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, facilities and much more via a partner company
Drinks and a selection of fruits



Have we awakened your interest?

Then click on "Apply now" below and Maryam Al-Dolaimy will be happy to receive your detailed application documents, stating your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.

Aroundtown, Personalabteilung, Wittestraße 30, Haus F, 13509 Berlin

Title: Data Analyst (ETL)/BI Analyst/BI Developer
Description:
Your role

To support the provision of quality financial and statistical information for senior management within agreed timescales and legal requirements.

What You'll Be Doing

What You'll Be Doing

Join our dynamic Business Performance team as a Data Analytics Engineer and play a pivotal role in shaping data strategies across our 11 European markets. Your expertise in data analysis will be instrumental in developing the analytical and reporting frameworks for our sales, revenue, and marketing divisions. By transforming data into actionable intelligence, you will significantly contribute to our business growth and market expansion.

Key Responsibilities


Maintain and develop new ETL pipelines.
Experience at the position of Data Engineer - 1+ years
Generate reports and data sets using advanced database and reporting systems.
Utilize analytical skills to address complex business challenges using diverse data sources.
Develop precise metrics that reflect business performance and strategic initiatives.


Professional Expertise

The Ideal Candidate Will Possess


Advanced SQL skills for complex data analysis and manipulation.
Proficiency in data programming with a strong command of Python, focusing on data manipulation libs (pyodbc, airflow, pandas, sqlalchemy, dask)
Strong knowledge of Tableau (including Tableau Prep).


Additional Qualifications (Preferred)


Experience with Salesforce reporting tools.


Experience with analytics in a B2B environment is highly valued.

About Corpay

Corpay is a global technology organisation that is leading the future of commercial payments with a culture of innovation that drives us to constantly create new and better ways to pay. Our specialized payment solutions help businesses control, simplify, and secure payment for fuel, general payables, toll and lodging expenses. Millions of people in over 80 countries around the world use our solutions for their payments.

All offers of employment made by Corpay (and its subsidiary companies) are subject to the successful completion of satisfactory pre-employment vetting by an independent supplier (Experian). This is in accordance with Corpay's Resourcing Policy and include employment referencing, identity, adverse financial, criminal and sanctions list checks. We do this to meet our legal and regulatory requirements.

Corpay is dedicated to encouraging a supportive and inclusive culture among our employees. It is within our best interest to promote diversity and eliminate discrimination in the workplace. We seek to ensure that all employees and job applicants are given equal opportunities.

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Corpay will not accept unsolicited CV's from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Corpay employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Corpay. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Für den digitalen Wandel in der Wirtschaftsprüfung suchen wir standortübergreifend ab sofort Verstärkung!

Um welchen Job geht es?

Leiste mit uns einen wertvollen Beitrag zu zukunftsweisenden digitalen Lösungen in der Wirtschaftsprüfung, indem du eine wachsende Mikrodienstlandschaft mitgestaltest!

Dabei...


trägst du zur Pflege und Erweiterung einer unternehmensweit genutzten, inhouse entwickelten BI-Anwendung bei.
unterstützt du unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen sowie Mandanten mit der Durchführung von Datenanalysen.
wirkst du an der Integration von KI-Systemen in unsere Systemlandschaft mit.
entwickelst du zusammen mit Mitarbeitenden anderer Teams und Fachbereiche neue Lösungen und hierzu erforderliche Microservices.


Worüber freuen wir uns?

Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse in R oder Python. Daneben verfügst du über Vorerfahrung im Data Wrangling mit dem Tidyverse oder pandas. Du bist geübt in der explorativen Datenanalyse sowie der Erstellung aussagekräftiger Tabellen und Grafiken. Anomalierkennung, Klassifikation, Zeitreihenanalyse oder Natural Language Processing sind für dich bekannte Aufgabenfelder. Zudem kommunizierst du sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch (C1).

Idealerweise verfügst du über Vorkenntnisse in Buchhaltung oder Controlling und Design, Implementierung und Wartung von RESTful Web APIs sowie über Kenntnis einschlägiger Protokolle und Datenaustauschformate.

Womit können wir punkten?

Zu­kunfts­ori­en­tier­tes Auf­ga­ben­feld: Bei uns ar­bei­test du mit brand­ak­tu­el­len The­men­stel­lun­gen und sorgst dafür, dass deine Kol­le­gin­nen und Kol­le­gen im Fach­be­reich mit mo­der­nen Me­tho­den un­terstützt wer­den. Da­bei eröff­nest du neue Möglich­kei­ten, die un­mit­tel­bar im Wirt­schaftsprüfungs­all­tag Ein­satz fin­den.

Echte Kol­le­gia­lität: Er­le­be un­ser of­fe­nes und wert­schätzen­des Mit­ein­an­der, mit dem wir ge­mein­sam als Team bestmögli­che Er­geb­nisse er­zie­len.

Her­aus­ra­gende Kar­rie­re­chan­cen: Freue dich auf in­di­vi­du­elle Förde­rung, an­spruchs­volle Pro­jekt­ar­beit und ein star­kes Netz­werk.

Be­ne­fits: Wir bie­ten dir ne­ben ei­ner at­trak­ti­ven Vergütung und Über­stun­den­re­ge­lung einen mo­der­nen Ar­beits­platz mit neu­es­ter IT-Aus­stat­tung und höhen­ver­stell­ba­rem Schreib­ti­sch. Wei­ter­hin kannst du An­ge­bote wie Cor­po­rate Be­ne­fits, Ent­gelt­um­wand­lun­gen für eine be­trieb­li­che Al­ters­vor­sorge so­wie ein Jo­brad oder Fa­mi­li­en­be­ne­fits wie u.a. Kita-Zu­schüsse oder An­ge­bote über un­se­ren Ko­ope­rati­ons­part­ner „pme Fa­mi­li­en­ser­vice“ wahr­neh­men.
Show more

Title: Junior Controller / Data Analyst
Description:
Die Havelland Express Frischdienst GmbH ist ein erfolgreiches mittelständisches Unternehmen, das die gehobene Hotellerie und Gastronomie mit Lebensmitteln beliefert. Als Vollsortimenter bieten wir unseren Kunden eine große Auswahl an frischen und tiefgekühlten Produkten. Von unserem Geschäftssitz in Berlin Tempelhof aus beliefern wir unsere Kunden in ganz Deutschland, Polen, Tschechien und im Baltikum.

Zur Verstärkung unseres hochmotivierten Teams suchen wir per sofort an unserem Standort Berlin in Vollzeit eine/n Junior Controller*in / Data Analyst, (m/w/d)

Aufgaben


Analyse von internen und externen Daten zur Identifizierung von Optimierungspotenzialen

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
We need people on the ground in Germany to evaluate and validate mapping data like locations, business names, opening hours, distances for navigation and more!




A high level of accuracy is required for this role as your analysis will have real world impact on mapping data shown to millions of people around the world.




Over time, successful candidates will be presented with new learning opportunities to develop their skills and progress on to more varied and intricate projects.




This is a part time (max 20hrs) highly flexible role where you’ll set your own hours and work to your own schedule.




Basic Requirements

Fluent in German and English
Living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Willing to work a minimum of 10 hours per week (pending project availability)
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
A passing grade in an online open-book assessment provided by us.




Benefits

Fully flexible working
Competitive rate of hourly pay
Learning resources provided for the assessment
Develop and apply your research skills in a real world environment

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office


LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
remote - Germany, Spain, Czech Republic, Portugal, Slovakia or Austria | Full-time | Start ASAP

About us 🚀

We accelerate the growth of digital companies by providing tailored funding solutions and data-driven financial insights. Our mission is to refine capital for economies to come. We want to enable every company to access funding that'll help them to thrive.

As a product- and tech-driven company we are founded by a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs. We are backed by Tier 1 venture capital investors that have also backed the likes of Stripe, Trade Republic, Telegram, Monday.com and Sorare.

Our values 💪🏼

We value flat hierarchies, full ownership and responsibility. Trust and open, honest communication are crucial to us, as it makes everything else easier. We work together and grow as a team.

Focus on Execution: We love and live off great ideas, but to create value we need to focus on execution.

Don't Fear Failure: We know that failure is an innate part of learning and success, so we value these experiences and take them as opportunities to try again and get better.

Trust Your Team: We trust our peers to do their best to achieve our shared goals, support each other and share their feedback so we can all grow and develop.

Your contribution to our success 🤓


You will write production-grade Python code for data applications that will be directly integrated into re:cap's platform
You will collaborate with our backend team (working mostly with Go) to ensure our solutions are successfully implemented from end-to-end
You will interface with different teams to gather business requirements and prototype solutions (e.g., Streamlit applications or Python scripts)
You will build pipelines to move data from various third-party sources into re:cap's data warehouse in Google BigQuery
You will maintain our data warehouse and ensure our data transformations are efficient and well structured using dbt and SQL


Who we are looking for 🕵🏽‍♀️


You are quick to iterate on your solutions
Your attention to detail ensures that the data you provide supports critical business decisions accurately
You're comfortable wearing multiple hats, from supporting the finance department with data analysis to building data pipelines and deploying data applications
You can effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences and translate their requirements into code
Experience with tech-driven and distributed companies is a plus
You have a valid EU work permit and reside within the EU. re:cap does not offer visa or relocation support at the moment


Our tech stack 👩🏽‍💻


Programming languages: Python, SQL and Go
Data ingestion: Airbyte
Data transformation: dbt
Data warehouse: Google BigQuery
Orchestration: Dagster
Analysis & reporting: Looker Studio, Streamlit
DevOps: AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, GitHub
Experience with our stack isn't a must


What you can expect 🪴


Remote first. Our team is located all over Germany and Europe, with the flexibility of 100% home office. However, if you are in Berlin you are more than welcome to come around the office and maybe even bring your furry friend 🐶
Stock options. Every employee receives stocks, because our success is also your success
Development opportunities. Because we care about your growth, we have regular feedback talks as well as set paths for the development of each employee
The latest tech equipment. Every new team member receives an Apple MacBook Air to guarantee smooth productivity
Flexibility. We offer flexible working hours and value asynchronous communication as well. On top we offer 25 vacation days
Team building. Meet the team at in-person on-sites, get a buddy to fully integrate into the company and join other team events
International travel health insurance. Prioritizing your well-being with comprehensive coverage, we guarantee your peace of mind wherever your travels take you
Workation. Experience the blend of work and leisure with our worldwide new benefit catering to your work-away-from-home needs
We care about security. You will receive 1password family membership
Choice. You get a monthly budget to finance a benefit of your choice


Even if not all of these points fit 100% we encourage you to apply! We hire also for attitude, not just for knowledge and are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

What comes after you apply? 🧚🏽‍♀️

Easy steps for a smooth hiring process


Application Review
Get to know re:cap
Case study/Take home Assignment (depending on the position)
Role-specific Interview
Get to know the team
Offer


We are committed to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where we provide equal opportunities regardless of age, gender identity, disability status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. Therefore we encourage you to apply as all qualified applications will be taken into consideration.
Show more

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You’ll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987
