Title: Associate Energy Data Management Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Über die Rolle

Wir suchen einen Energy Data Management Analyst (w/m/d) für unser Berliner Büro am Ernst-Reuter-Platz. Diese Person wird unseren Energiedatanmanager direkt unterstützen, um den reibungslosen Ablauf der täglichen und monatlichen Bilanzierung und Abrechnung bei Trailstone zu gewährleisten.




In dieser Funktion haben Sie die Möglichkeit, den deutschen Energiemarkt von der Pike auf zu lernen und zu verstehen, um rechtzeitig zum Datenspezialisten für das Unternehmen zu werden. Als natürlich kollaborative Rolle haben Sie auch die Möglichkeit, mit den Originatoren, Analysten und externen Marktpartnern von Trailstone als wichtige Datenquelle zu arbeiten, die für ihre Geschäftsentscheidungen entscheidend ist. Wir sind wirklich begeistert von dieser Rolle und der Exposition, die diese Person haben wird, während sie sich in unserem Unternehmen weiterentwickeln kann.




Dies wird eine Vollzeitstelle mit folgenden Aufgaben:

Energiedatenanalyse und -verarbeitung: Verantwortung für die Analyse eingehender Daten im Bereich Messdatenmanagement. Dazu gehören die Identifizierung und Lösung von Problemen sowie die Plausibilitätsprüfung von Vorwerten.
Koordination mit Marktpartnern: Sorgen Sie für eine enge Abstimmung mit anderen Marktpartnern, um eine konsistente reibungslose Datenübertragung zu gewährleisten. Dies beinhaltet die Kommunikation und Koordination bezüglich der Übertragung und des Austauschs von Daten.
Stammdatenverwaltung: Die Verwaltung der Stammdaten von Erzeugungsanlagen erfordert genaue und sorgfältige Arbeit.







Über Sie

Dieser Mitarbeiter wird sich einem kleinen Team in Berlin anschließen, um unseren Energiehandel durch Datenmanagement zu unterstützen und zu stärken. Das Interesse an den Erneuerbaren Energien und die Liebe zum Detail werden hier der Schlüssel zum Erfolg sein. Als Associate Level in unserem Unternehmen eignet sich diese Rolle am besten für jemanden, der seine Karriere nach dem Abschluss seines akademischen Studiums beginnen möchte.




Außerdem suchen wir jemanden mit folgenden Eigenschaften:

Ausbildung: Ein kürzlich abgeschlossenes Ausbildung (z.B. Industriekaufmann IT System Management, etc.) oder ein Bacherlor-Abschluss ist erforderlich.
IT-Wissen: Ein sehr gutes Verständnis von IT-Systemen und -Prozessen ist unerlässlich, um die komplexen Datenflüsse und -systeme im Energiesektor effektiv zu steuern.
Analytische Fähigkeiten: Die Freude an der Analyse und Aufklärung unbekannter Zusammenhänge sowie eine analytische, zielorientierte und lösungsorientierte Denkweise sind entscheidend.
Unabhängigkeit und Initiative: Die Fähigkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten und Initiative zu zeigen, ist entscheidend für den Erfolg in dieser Rolle.
Branchenerfahrung: Einige Erfahrung im Energiesektor ist wünschenswert, um die spezifischen Herausforderungen und Anforderungen der Branche zu verstehen. Dies ist jedoch nicht unbedingt zu berücksichtigen.
Sprachkenntnisse: Mindestens C1 Niveau in Deutsch sowie B1 oder B2 Niveau in Englisch.




Sie erfüllen nicht jede Anforderung? Studien haben gezeigt, dass Frauen und Einzelpersonen aus Minderheiten oft zögern, sich um Stellen zu bewerben, wenn sie nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen. Wir setzen uns dafür ein, einen inklusiven und authentischen Arbeitsplatz für alle zu schaffen. Wenn Sie diese Position reizt, aber Ihre Qualifikationen oder Erfahrungen nicht perfekt mit der Stellenbeschreibung übereinstimmen, empfehlen wir Ihnen dennoch, sich zu bewerben. Sie könnten der ideale Kandidat für diese Position sein oder vielleicht eine weitere Gelegenheit in unserem expandierenden Geschäft.







Was wir bieten

Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung und Beteiligung an Trailstones Ermessenszulage.
Die Möglichkeit, ein neues Geschäftsfeld mitzugestalten und so selbst zu wachsen.
25 Tage jährlicher Urlaubsanspruch.
Ein soziales Arbeitsumfeld in neuen Büroräumen mit einer offenen Kultur.
Flache Hierarchien und eine No-Ego-Kultur für direkte Entscheidungsprozesse ohne Bürokratie.
Berechtigung für externe und interne Schulungen gemäß unserer Learning & Development Policy.
Anspruch auf einen jährlichen Arbeitgeberbeitrag zu Ihrer privaten Rente.







Hier bei Trailstone...

Wir wissen, wie wichtig Vielfalt für unseren Erfolg ist. Wir bemühen uns aktiv, unsere Organisation weiter zu diversifizieren und begrüßen Bewerbungen von Menschen aller Herkunft, Nationalität, Ethnie, Geschlecht, Alter, Religion, Behinderung und sexueller Orientierung sowie Veteranen und Einzelpersonen aus anderen unterrepräsentierten Gruppen.

Wir verstehen, dass es bei Vielfalt nicht nur um Repräsentation geht, sondern darum, eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven zusammenzubringen, um Innovationen zu fördern und bessere Entscheidungen zu treffen. Wir glauben an die Kraft der verschiedenen Perspektiven und engagieren uns für den Aufbau eines Arbeitsplatzes, an dem jeder gedeihen und zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg beitragen kann.

Begleiten Sie uns auf unserem Weg zu einer inklusiveren Zukunft.







Über Trailstone

Trailstone ist ein globales Energie- und Technologieunternehmen, das an der Schnittstelle zwischen erneuerbaren und konventionellen Energien tätig ist. Wir handeln mit Energie auf globalen Märkten und bieten einen erstklassigen Service, um die inhärente Fluktuation der erneuerbaren Stromerzeugung kurz-, mittel- und langfristig zu bewältigen. Als Energiehändler kaufen und verkaufen wir Strom und Gas, das physisch über die Netze geliefert wird, und wir nutzen unser physisches Marktwissen, um Finanzrohstoffe zu handeln. Als Anbieter von Managementdienstleistungen für erneuerbare Energien übernehmen wir die Komplexität des Managements erneuerbarer Energien in verschiedenen Ländern, damit sich unsere Kunden auf ihre Kernmission von Investitionen und Wachstum konzentrieren können. Trailstone bietet eine effiziente, vollautomatische Front-to-Back-Plattform für das Management erneuerbarer Energien, die auf unserer langjährigen Markterfahrung, proprietären Technologien, Datenanalysen und Meteorologie basiert.

Show more
HTML:
Über die Rolle

Wir suchen einen Energy Data Management Analyst (w/m/d) für unser Berliner Büro am Ernst-Reuter-Platz. Diese Person wird unseren Energiedatanmanager direkt unterstützen, um den reibungslosen Ablauf der täglichen und monatlichen Bilanzierung und Abrechnung bei Trailstone zu gewährleisten.


In dieser Funktion haben Sie die Möglichkeit, den deutschen Energiemarkt von der Pike auf zu lernen und zu verstehen, um rechtzeitig zum Datenspezialisten für das Unternehmen zu werden. Als natürlich kollaborative Rolle haben Sie auch die Möglichkeit, mit den Originatoren, Analysten und externen Marktpartnern von Trailstone als wichtige Datenquelle zu arbeiten, die für ihre Geschäftsentscheidungen entscheidend ist. Wir sind wirklich begeistert von dieser Rolle und der Exposition, die diese Person haben wird, während sie sich in unserem Unternehmen weiterentwickeln kann.


Dies wird eine Vollzeitstelle mit folgenden Aufgaben:

  • Energiedatenanalyse und -verarbeitung: Verantwortung für die Analyse eingehender Daten im Bereich Messdatenmanagement. Dazu gehören die Identifizierung und Lösung von Problemen sowie die Plausibilitätsprüfung von Vorwerten.
  • Koordination mit Marktpartnern: Sorgen Sie für eine enge Abstimmung mit anderen Marktpartnern, um eine konsistente reibungslose Datenübertragung zu gewährleisten. Dies beinhaltet die Kommunikation und Koordination bezüglich der Übertragung und des Austauschs von Daten.
  • Stammdatenverwaltung: Die Verwaltung der Stammdaten von Erzeugungsanlagen erfordert genaue und sorgfältige Arbeit.



Über Sie

Dieser Mitarbeiter wird sich einem kleinen Team in Berlin anschließen, um unseren Energiehandel durch Datenmanagement zu unterstützen und zu stärken. Das Interesse an den Erneuerbaren Energien und die Liebe zum Detail werden hier der Schlüssel zum Erfolg sein. Als Associate Level in unserem Unternehmen eignet sich diese Rolle am besten für jemanden, der seine Karriere nach dem Abschluss seines akademischen Studiums beginnen möchte.


Außerdem suchen wir jemanden mit folgenden Eigenschaften:

  • Ausbildung: Ein kürzlich abgeschlossenes Ausbildung (z.B. Industriekaufmann IT System Management, etc.) oder ein Bacherlor-Abschluss ist erforderlich.
  • IT-Wissen: Ein sehr gutes Verständnis von IT-Systemen und -Prozessen ist unerlässlich, um die komplexen Datenflüsse und -systeme im Energiesektor effektiv zu steuern.
  • Analytische Fähigkeiten: Die Freude an der Analyse und Aufklärung unbekannter Zusammenhänge sowie eine analytische, zielorientierte und lösungsorientierte Denkweise sind entscheidend.
  • Unabhängigkeit und Initiative: Die Fähigkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten und Initiative zu zeigen, ist entscheidend für den Erfolg in dieser Rolle.
  • Branchenerfahrung: Einige Erfahrung im Energiesektor ist wünschenswert, um die spezifischen Herausforderungen und Anforderungen der Branche zu verstehen. Dies ist jedoch nicht unbedingt zu berücksichtigen.
  • Sprachkenntnisse: Mindestens C1 Niveau in Deutsch sowie B1 oder B2 Niveau in Englisch.


Sie erfüllen nicht jede Anforderung? Studien haben gezeigt, dass Frauen und Einzelpersonen aus Minderheiten oft zögern, sich um Stellen zu bewerben, wenn sie nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen. Wir setzen uns dafür ein, einen inklusiven und authentischen Arbeitsplatz für alle zu schaffen. Wenn Sie diese Position reizt, aber Ihre Qualifikationen oder Erfahrungen nicht perfekt mit der Stellenbeschreibung übereinstimmen, empfehlen wir Ihnen dennoch, sich zu bewerben. Sie könnten der ideale Kandidat für diese Position sein oder vielleicht eine weitere Gelegenheit in unserem expandierenden Geschäft.



Was wir bieten

  • Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung und Beteiligung an Trailstones Ermessenszulage.
  • Die Möglichkeit, ein neues Geschäftsfeld mitzugestalten und so selbst zu wachsen.
  • 25 Tage jährlicher Urlaubsanspruch.
  • Ein soziales Arbeitsumfeld in neuen Büroräumen mit einer offenen Kultur.
  • Flache Hierarchien und eine No-Ego-Kultur für direkte Entscheidungsprozesse ohne Bürokratie.
  • Berechtigung für externe und interne Schulungen gemäß unserer Learning & Development Policy.
  • Anspruch auf einen jährlichen Arbeitgeberbeitrag zu Ihrer privaten Rente.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About the Job

We're looking for a motivated Data Engineer (m/f/d) to join our Data & Analytics team and support its Data strategies.

In your day-to-day work, you'll focus on building data-driven applications and get the opportunity to contribute to various projects.

Our Data and Analytics team enables our portfolio companies and external partners to grow sustainably as they shift from intuitive to objective decision-making through reliable data collection, proper data infrastructure implementation, and effective data initiatives.

We firmly believe that the decade of data has begun: Powerful technologies are readily accessible to turn raw data into real insights, products, features and more. We are looking for capable talents from various backgrounds to tag along on our journey to utilise data to create real impact via scalable Data / ML infrastructure, thorough analyses & meaningful relationships to ensure proper application.

In this role, you'll:


Build high-quality data warehouses, marketing automations, recommendation engines, etc.
Integrate data from various systems into flexible and consistent representations
Explore and evaluate the lasting impact of AI use cases and their implementation
Ensure that all people and IT systems in the organisation have easy access to data, through various front-ends and interfaces
Work in an agile software development process and collaborate closely with the Analytics team
Impact the business while working in an amazing cross-functional team environment


Your Profile


Genuine interest in data and algorithms, and an excitement for solving difficult business problems through scalable data products
Knowledge of version control systems, web technologies, software engineering best practices, and the inner workings of database systems
The ability to turn data science into something that creates business value - is a plus
Desire to learn new things (we know you can "fly at least one type of plane", and we will provide you with many types and variations of said plane)
Good communication skills in English (native/full working proficiency)
A degree in computer science or a comparable qualification


Please note that we're looking for support in our Berlin office. Eligibility to work in the EU is required.

Benefits and Perks:


Remote-friendly – Work anywhere in Germany or take advantage of our beautiful and well-equipped office at the heart of Berlin
Choose your tech – Macbook/Windows/Linux laptop and optional screen.
Career growth – Access to internal workshops, knowledge-sharing meetups, PAV Academy professional training opportunities, industry conferences, and other personal development possibilities
Subsidised products and services, including meal vouchers, German language classes, a bike leasing program, and discounts on services of our portfolio companies and various other brands
Wellness – 24/7 access to counseling specialists, free subscription to workplace wellbeing platform Unmind, weekly online yoga classes
Paid team and company events
Social activities – Hang out with co-workers during and after-hours (Slack or IRL, you decide), grab lunch or coffee with randomly assigned teammates, and disconnect from everything to spend quality time in outdoor activities
Visa application support and relocation package


Apply below and become a part of our success story!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Project A is committed to diverse and equal opportunities hiring for all – applicants, candidates, and employees alike. We value humans – with all our glorious multifaceted backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences – and look forward to your application.
Show more

Title: Data Analytics Mandatory Internship in Finance starting September 2024
Description:
At Daimler Truck we want to make a change, to create real impact together. That is why we take responsibility around the globe and work as one global team towards our vision: Leading Sustainable Transportation. It's people who make the difference and drive success. Together, we will achieve a more sustainable transportation, reduce our carbon footprint, increase safety on and off the track, develop smarter technology and financial solutions. All essential, to fulfill our purpose

for all who keep the world moving.

YOU

MAKE

US

– YOU MAKE THE DIFFERENCEABOUT USAt Daimler Truck, we change today's transportation and create real impact together. We take responsibility around the globe and work together on making our vision become reality: Leading Sustainable Transportation. As one global team, we drive our progress and success together – everyone at Daimler Truck makes the difference. Together, we want to achieve a sustainable transportation, reduce our carbon footprint, increase safety on and off the track, develop smarter technology and attractive financial solutions. All essential, to fulfill our purpose - for all who keep the world moving.Become part of our team!We as Finance Analytics team develop scalable solutions for Finance & Controlling with the goal of enabling data-driven decisions and increasing process automation. We employ Artificial Intelligence to analyze large and complex datasets, derive forecasts for key business metrics, and quantify the impact of relevant influencing factors.Are you passionate about data and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting? We're seeking a motivated intern to support our Cash-Flow Analytics project. Within this project, you'll contribute to scale and further develop our Cash-Flow Forecasting solution to improve the forecasting quality and explainability as well as give steering impulses to our management. As an intern, you'll collaborate closely with experienced data scientists and business experts. Whether you're interested in machine learning, statistical analysis, or data visualization, this internship offers a unique opportunity to learn and grow.WHAT YOU CAN EXPECTExtract and process data and perform analysis using Excel and PythonUse case professionalization in Microsoft Azure (Data factory & Databricks)Support in further development of the Cash-Flow forecasting method, such as extending the forecasting horizon or including payment behaviorBring in your knowledge and ideas to setup a suitable time-series forecasting model both from business and data science perspective

THAT'S WHY YOU ARE A MATCHYou study (Business-) mathematics, physics, Data Science, (Business-) informatics, economics, Industrial Engineering and Management or comparable studiesProgramming skills: R or PythonExperience in data wrangling techniques, statistics and

basics in Machine Learning algorithmsStrong Interest in Finance & ControllingKnowledge of MS-Office toots as well as MS-Access/SQLLanguage skills:very good English skills, German basics preferableCommitment, teamwork and analytical thinkingMAKEYOURMOVE and apply now – we‘re looking forward to it!This position is limited to 6 months.

At Daimler Truck, we promote diversity and foster an inclusive corporate culture. We value the individual strengths of our employees, as these lead to the best team performance and thus to the success of our company. Inclusion and Equal opportunities are important to us – regardless of where you come from and who you are. We look forward to receiving applications from people of all cultures and genders, parents, people with disabilities and people from the LGBTIQ+ community.JBSC1_DE

Title: Data Center Efficiency Analyst (m/w/d) - Einstellung 2025
Description:
Du überlegst, nächstes Jahr deinen Job zu wechseln? Dann könnte diese Stelle dein nächster Karriereschritt sein!

Unser Kunde ist einer der weltweit führenden Anbieter von IT-Beratung, digitaler Transformation und Technologiedienstleistungen. Das Unternehmen ist der größte Consulting-Anbieter europäischen Ursprungs, mit 300.000+ Beschäftigten in über 40 Ländern.

Das Unternehmen wird 2025 einen neuen Bereich aufbauen für den Bereich "Nachhaltigkeit in der IT" und möchte gerne jetzt schon potenzielle Interessierte kennenlernen für die Rolle des

Data Center Efficiency Analyst (m/w/d).

Standort: du kannst vom Home Office aus arbeiten, solltest aber bereit sein, bei Bedarf an persönlichen Kundenterminen teilzunehmen.

Was dich erwartet:


Eine Schlüsselrolle in der Entwicklung effizienter Rechenzentrumslösungen.
Mitgestaltung nachhaltiger IT-Strategien in einem global agierenden Unternehmen.
Einflussnahme auf die Energieeffizienz und Ressourcennutzung im Rechenzentrum.
Eigenständiges Arbeiten in einem Umfeld, das Eigeninitiative und Fachwissen schätzt.


Deine Verantwortlichkeiten:


Analyse und Bewertung der Energieeffizienz von Rechenzentren.
Management von Infrastrukturprojekten zur Steigerung der operativen Effizienz.
Entwicklung und Implementierung von Strategien für nachhaltige Rechenzentren.
Eigenverantwortliche Projektarbeit und Beiträge zur Sustainability-Community.


Dein Profil:


Hochschulabschluss in IT-nahen Studiengängen oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Erfahrung in der Rechenzentrenanalyse und im IT-Betrieb.
Kenntnisse aktueller Technologietrends und EU-Rechtsrahmen.
Starkes Interesse an dem Thema Nachhaltigkeit.
Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse.


Interesse?

Dann bewirb dich gleich hier online und wir melden uns in Kürze bei Dir. Bei Fragen hilft dir Nora gerne weiter. Kontaktiere sie einfach unter nora@indivhr.com. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Für den digitalen Wandel in der Wirtschaftsprüfung suchen wir standortübergreifend ab sofort Verstärkung!

Um welchen Job geht es?

Leiste mit uns einen wertvollen Beitrag zu zukunftsweisenden digitalen Lösungen in der Wirtschaftsprüfung, indem du eine wachsende Mikrodienstlandschaft mitgestaltest!

Dabei...


trägst du zur Pflege und Erweiterung einer unternehmensweit genutzten, inhouse entwickelten BI-Anwendung bei.
unterstützt du unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen sowie Mandanten mit der Durchführung von Datenanalysen.
wirkst du an der Integration von KI-Systemen in unsere Systemlandschaft mit.
entwickelst du zusammen mit Mitarbeitenden anderer Teams und Fachbereiche neue Lösungen und hierzu erforderliche Microservices.


Worüber freuen wir uns?

Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse in R oder Python. Daneben verfügst du über Vorerfahrung im Data Wrangling mit dem Tidyverse oder pandas. Du bist geübt in der explorativen Datenanalyse sowie der Erstellung aussagekräftiger Tabellen und Grafiken. Anomalierkennung, Klassifikation, Zeitreihenanalyse oder Natural Language Processing sind für dich bekannte Aufgabenfelder. Zudem kommunizierst du sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch (C1).

Idealerweise verfügst du über Vorkenntnisse in Buchhaltung oder Controlling und Design, Implementierung und Wartung von RESTful Web APIs sowie über Kenntnis einschlägiger Protokolle und Datenaustauschformate.

Womit können wir punkten?

Zu­kunfts­ori­en­tier­tes Auf­ga­ben­feld: Bei uns ar­bei­test du mit brand­ak­tu­el­len The­men­stel­lun­gen und sorgst dafür, dass deine Kol­le­gin­nen und Kol­le­gen im Fach­be­reich mit mo­der­nen Me­tho­den un­terstützt wer­den. Da­bei eröff­nest du neue Möglich­kei­ten, die un­mit­tel­bar im Wirt­schaftsprüfungs­all­tag Ein­satz fin­den.

Echte Kol­le­gia­lität: Er­le­be un­ser of­fe­nes und wert­schätzen­des Mit­ein­an­der, mit dem wir ge­mein­sam als Team bestmögli­che Er­geb­nisse er­zie­len.

Her­aus­ra­gende Kar­rie­re­chan­cen: Freue dich auf in­di­vi­du­elle Förde­rung, an­spruchs­volle Pro­jekt­ar­beit und ein star­kes Netz­werk.

Be­ne­fits: Wir bie­ten dir ne­ben ei­ner at­trak­ti­ven Vergütung und Über­stun­den­re­ge­lung einen mo­der­nen Ar­beits­platz mit neu­es­ter IT-Aus­stat­tung und höhen­ver­stell­ba­rem Schreib­ti­sch. Wei­ter­hin kannst du An­ge­bote wie Cor­po­rate Be­ne­fits, Ent­gelt­um­wand­lun­gen für eine be­trieb­li­che Al­ters­vor­sorge so­wie ein Jo­brad oder Fa­mi­li­en­be­ne­fits wie u.a. Kita-Zu­schüsse oder An­ge­bote über un­se­ren Ko­ope­rati­ons­part­ner „pme Fa­mi­li­en­ser­vice“ wahr­neh­men.
Show more
HTML:
Für den digitalen Wandel in der Wirtschaftsprüfung suchen wir standortübergreifend ab sofort Verstärkung!

Um welchen Job geht es?

Leiste mit uns einen wertvollen Beitrag zu zukunftsweisenden digitalen Lösungen in der Wirtschaftsprüfung, indem du eine wachsende Mikrodienstlandschaft mitgestaltest!

Dabei...

  • trägst du zur Pflege und Erweiterung einer unternehmensweit genutzten, inhouse entwickelten BI-Anwendung bei.
  • unterstützt du unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen sowie Mandanten mit der Durchführung von Datenanalysen.
  • wirkst du an der Integration von KI-Systemen in unsere Systemlandschaft mit.
  • entwickelst du zusammen mit Mitarbeitenden anderer Teams und Fachbereiche neue Lösungen und hierzu erforderliche Microservices.

Worüber freuen wir uns?

Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse in R oder Python. Daneben verfügst du über Vorerfahrung im Data Wrangling mit dem Tidyverse oder pandas. Du bist geübt in der explorativen Datenanalyse sowie der Erstellung aussagekräftiger Tabellen und Grafiken. Anomalierkennung, Klassifikation, Zeitreihenanalyse oder Natural Language Processing sind für dich bekannte Aufgabenfelder. Zudem kommunizierst du sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch (C1).

Idealerweise verfügst du über Vorkenntnisse in Buchhaltung oder Controlling und Design, Implementierung und Wartung von RESTful Web APIs sowie über Kenntnis einschlägiger Protokolle und Datenaustauschformate.

Womit können wir punkten?

Zu­kunfts­ori­en­tier­tes Auf­ga­ben­feld: Bei uns ar­bei­test du mit brand­ak­tu­el­len The­men­stel­lun­gen und sorgst dafür, dass deine Kol­le­gin­nen und Kol­le­gen im Fach­be­reich mit mo­der­nen Me­tho­den un­terstützt wer­den. Da­bei eröff­nest du neue Möglich­kei­ten, die un­mit­tel­bar im Wirt­schaftsprüfungs­all­tag Ein­satz fin­den.

Echte Kol­le­gia­lität: Er­le­be un­ser of­fe­nes und wert­schätzen­des Mit­ein­an­der, mit dem wir ge­mein­sam als Team bestmögli­che Er­geb­nisse er­zie­len.

Her­aus­ra­gende Kar­rie­re­chan­cen: Freue dich auf in­di­vi­du­elle Förde­rung, an­spruchs­volle Pro­jekt­ar­beit und ein star­kes Netz­werk.

Be­ne­fits: Wir bie­ten dir ne­ben ei­ner at­trak­ti­ven Vergütung und Über­stun­den­re­ge­lung einen mo­der­nen Ar­beits­platz mit neu­es­ter IT-Aus­stat­tung und höhen­ver­stell­ba­rem Schreib­ti­sch. Wei­ter­hin kannst du An­ge­bote wie Cor­po­rate Be­ne­fits, Ent­gelt­um­wand­lun­gen für eine be­trieb­li­che Al­ters­vor­sorge so­wie ein Jo­brad oder Fa­mi­li­en­be­ne­fits wie u.a. Kita-Zu­schüsse oder An­ge­bote über un­se­ren Ko­ope­rati­ons­part­ner „pme Fa­mi­li­en­ser­vice“ wahr­neh­men.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Bestandskunden
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Unterstützung bei Entwicklung und Implementierung einer effizienten Power BI Reportingstruktur
Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von relevanten Kennzahlen und Geschäftsentwicklungen
Präsentation der Dashboards in deutscher Sprache für große Bestandskunden
Weiterentwicklung der BI-Architektur und der Automatisierung des Reportings in Zusammenarbeit mit der Fachabteilung


Dein Profil


mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Kundenservice, Vertrieb oder einer anderen beratenden Tätigkeit
sehr gute Vorkenntnisse mit Programmen zur Datenauswertung (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Schrift und Sprache
Sicherer Umgang mit Excel und SQL
sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten für Kunden in deutscher Sprache
Kenntnisse im Auf-/Ausbau von BI-Systemen
Strukturierte, sowie analytische Arbeitsweise
Idealerweise verfügst Du über Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement im SaaS-Umfeld


Warum wir?


Die "Basics": 30 Tage Urlaub, bis zu 100% remote work möglich, ein fester Feierabend, Mac oder PC- du hast die Wahl, ein Budget für deine Weiterentwicklung, Team-Events, E-Bike, Altersvorsorge und Gutscheine für Amazon & Co. sind einige der Angebote, die unsere CallOne´ler zu schätzen wissen.
We ♥️ AI: Nicht nur bei unseren SaaS-Lösungen, auch im Arbeitsalltag setzen wir auf die unzähligen Möglichkeiten, die KI uns bietet, um Prozesse zu optimieren und uns unsere Arbeit zu erleichtern. Freu dich auf ein tech- und experimentier-freudiges Team, mit dem du tief in die Welt der Künstlichen Intelligenz eintauchen kannst! =)
Arbeit mit Sinn: Mit deiner Arbeit hast du einen positiven Einfluss auf Millionen von Menschen. Unsere Lösungen sind immer einen Herzschlag voraus und setzen neue Standards im Kundenservice. So leistest du mit deiner Arbeit einen echten Mehrwert und trägst dazu bei, dass Service Hotlines ihrem Namen endlich wieder alle Ehre machen.
Teamwork: Was wir an CallOne besonders lieben? Unsere Kollegen (w/m/d)! Wir halten einander den Rücken frei, nehmen uns selbst nicht zu ernst und können uns immer aufeinander verlassen. Egal ob remote oder an einem unserer drei Standorte, bei uns ist Team Work keine hohle Phrase!
Job Crafting 4.0: Du gestaltest deinen Job, mit deiner Erfahrung, deinen Stärken, Ideen und Vorlieben. Wir fördern dich mit allem, was du dafür brauchst, und entwerfen gemeinsamen den Job, der zu dir und deinem Leben passt.
Gemeinsam wachsen: Dein Wissen ist unser aller Gewinn. Deshalb spielen wir dir regelmäßig Updates auf, in Form von Konferenzen, Workshops, Kursen, Trainings, neuster Technik – was immer du brauchst, um dich beruflich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln.
Kein Lari-Fari: Was du tust, vergammelt nicht in einer Schublade, sondern kommt zum Einsatz. Auf unnötige Bürokratie und stundenlange Meetings haben wir keine Lust. Wir arbeiten fokussiert, hands-on und mit einem Blick fürs Wesentliche.


Über uns

Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der Kommunikation!

Bist du bereit für den nächsten Schritt? Wir suchen kreative Köpfe, die mit uns und mit Hilfe von KI-gestützten Technologien die Art und Weise, wie Unternehmen interagieren, neu definieren wollen. Lass dich von unserer Vision inspirieren und entdecke spannenden Karrieremöglichkeiten bei uns – bewirb dich noch heute auf unsere offenen Stellen!

Du möchtest mehr über uns erfahren? ➡️ comdesk.de/ueber-uns

Title: Junior Controller / Data Analyst
Description:
Die Havelland Express Frischdienst GmbH ist ein erfolgreiches mittelständisches Unternehmen, das die gehobene Hotellerie und Gastronomie mit Lebensmitteln beliefert. Als Vollsortimenter bieten wir unseren Kunden eine große Auswahl an frischen und tiefgekühlten Produkten. Von unserem Geschäftssitz in Berlin Tempelhof aus beliefern wir unsere Kunden in ganz Deutschland, Polen, Tschechien und im Baltikum.

Zur Verstärkung unseres hochmotivierten Teams suchen wir per sofort an unserem Standort Berlin in Vollzeit eine/n Junior Controller*in / Data Analyst, (m/w/d)

Aufgaben


Analyse von internen und externen Daten zur Identifizierung von Optimierungspotenzialen
Überwachung der Preis- und Erlösentwicklung
Budgetüberwachung und -steuerung
Erstellung von Wirtschaftlichkeitsanalysen, Deckungsbeitragsrechnung, statistischen Meldungen und adhoc-Auswertungen
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Datenqualität, Stammdatenpflege
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen IT und Einkauf, Lager & Logistik, QS, Verkauf


Profil


Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwesen, Mathematik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Wirtschaftsingenieurswesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL
Erste bis mehrjährige Erfahrung oder Praktika im Controlling und Bereich Datenanalyse
Optional: Erfahrung bei der Implementierung von KI-unterstützter Software
Ausgeprägtes Zahlenverständnis, Leistungsbereitschaft, Teamfähigkeit und Flexibilität
Gute Organisations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, selbständiges Arbeiten
Sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse, insbesondere MS Excel
IT-Kenntnisse: SQL von Vorteil, BI-Software Qlik von Vorteil
Deutsch C1 / Englisch B1


Wir bieten

Wir bieten eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung, einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten und dynamischen Team.


Leistungsgerechte Vergütung
Moderner Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten Team
Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte und Sozialleistungen
Regelmäßige Firmenevents
BVG-Zuschuss und Parkplätze vorhanden
Kantine und Getränkeversorgung im Unternehmen


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
remote - Germany, Spain, Czech Republic, Portugal, Slovakia or Austria | Full-time | Start ASAP

About us 🚀

We accelerate the growth of digital companies by providing tailored funding solutions and data-driven financial insights. Our mission is to refine capital for economies to come. We want to enable every company to access funding that'll help them to thrive.

As a product- and tech-driven company we are founded by a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs. We are backed by Tier 1 venture capital investors that have also backed the likes of Stripe, Trade Republic, Telegram, Monday.com and Sorare.

Our values 💪🏼

We value flat hierarchies, full ownership and responsibility. Trust and open, honest communication are crucial to us, as it makes everything else easier. We work together and grow as a team.

Focus on Execution: We love and live off great ideas, but to create value we need to focus on execution.

Don't Fear Failure: We know that failure is an innate part of learning and success, so we value these experiences and take them as opportunities to try again and get better.

Trust Your Team: We trust our peers to do their best to achieve our shared goals, support each other and share their feedback so we can all grow and develop.

Your contribution to our success 🤓


You will write production-grade Python code for data applications that will be directly integrated into re:cap's platform
You will collaborate with our backend team (working mostly with Go) to ensure our solutions are successfully implemented from end-to-end
You will interface with different teams to gather business requirements and prototype solutions (e.g., Streamlit applications or Python scripts)
You will build pipelines to move data from various third-party sources into re:cap's data warehouse in Google BigQuery
You will maintain our data warehouse and ensure our data transformations are efficient and well structured using dbt and SQL


Who we are looking for 🕵🏽‍♀️


You are quick to iterate on your solutions
Your attention to detail ensures that the data you provide supports critical business decisions accurately
You're comfortable wearing multiple hats, from supporting the finance department with data analysis to building data pipelines and deploying data applications
You can effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences and translate their requirements into code
Experience with tech-driven and distributed companies is a plus
You have a valid EU work permit and reside within the EU. re:cap does not offer visa or relocation support at the moment


Our tech stack 👩🏽‍💻


Programming languages: Python, SQL and Go
Data ingestion: Airbyte
Data transformation: dbt
Data warehouse: Google BigQuery
Orchestration: Dagster
Analysis & reporting: Looker Studio, Streamlit
DevOps: AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, GitHub
Experience with our stack isn't a must


What you can expect 🪴


Remote first. Our team is located all over Germany and Europe, with the flexibility of 100% home office. However, if you are in Berlin you are more than welcome to come around the office and maybe even bring your furry friend 🐶
Stock options. Every employee receives stocks, because our success is also your success
Development opportunities. Because we care about your growth, we have regular feedback talks as well as set paths for the development of each employee
The latest tech equipment. Every new team member receives an Apple MacBook Air to guarantee smooth productivity
Flexibility. We offer flexible working hours and value asynchronous communication as well. On top we offer 25 vacation days
Team building. Meet the team at in-person on-sites, get a buddy to fully integrate into the company and join other team events
International travel health insurance. Prioritizing your well-being with comprehensive coverage, we guarantee your peace of mind wherever your travels take you
Workation. Experience the blend of work and leisure with our worldwide new benefit catering to your work-away-from-home needs
We care about security. You will receive 1password family membership
Choice. You get a monthly budget to finance a benefit of your choice


Even if not all of these points fit 100% we encourage you to apply! We hire also for attitude, not just for knowledge and are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

What comes after you apply? 🧚🏽‍♀️

Easy steps for a smooth hiring process


Application Review
Get to know re:cap
Case study/Take home Assignment (depending on the position)
Role-specific Interview
Get to know the team
Offer


We are committed to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where we provide equal opportunities regardless of age, gender identity, disability status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. Therefore we encourage you to apply as all qualified applications will be taken into consideration.
Show more

We are committed to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where we provide equal opportunities regardless of age, gender identity, disability status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. Therefore we encourage you to apply as all qualified applications will be taken into consideration.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

In light of rapidly evolving and scaling up its development trajectory, Billie has recently set up a Portfolio Risk Management function. The main objective is to measure, control and drive decisions to optimize one of the core business metrics - portfolio losses. In order to do so, the team manages risk by researching and innovating, strategizing and recommending risk mitigating actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data (Risk) Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team and contribute to the development and enhancement of our portfolio risk management system.

In this role, you will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide risk decisions within the company values and expectations and be able to mitigate risks while at the same time embrace growth opportunities.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

Responsibilities


Perform in-depth portfolio data analysis from various angles (credit risk, fraud, acceptance rate and funnel) to develop a deep understanding of business processes and product, and to support risk optimisation
Design data models as part of data business warehouses to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update Portfolio management dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding portfolio performance, communicate key insights and recommendations to relevant stakeholders
Perform in-depth data analysis to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Identify and analyze potential sources of loss to minimize risk and estimate the potential financial consequences of a loss
Connect all business stakeholders in order to present portfolio’s KPIs and drive the business approach to managing risk
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have at least 3-4 years proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative risk analytics
You have excellent proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Experience in designing KPI dashboards for all types of audiences up to C-level
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You are proficient in data visualization and analytics tools, like Tableau, Power BI, Looker
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organised, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple responsibilities
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more
HTML:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

In light of rapidly evolving and scaling up its development trajectory, Billie has recently set up a Portfolio Risk Management function. The main objective is to measure, control and drive decisions to optimize one of the core business metrics - portfolio losses. In order to do so, the team manages risk by researching and innovating, strategizing and recommending risk mitigating actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

Responsibilities

  • Connect all business stakeholders in order to present portfolio’s KPIs and drive the business approach to managing risk
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • Excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple responsibilities
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Founded in 2021, our company operates a pioneering marketplace that redefines one of the largest supply chains in the world. Our mission is to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing global access to high-quality products through our innovative platform. Since our launch in January 2022, we have operated discreetly, successfully serving hundreds of companies without a public profile or media coverage. We cater to both major industry players and mid-sized companies, utilising a cutting-edge technology platform that is experiencing rapid growth. Having secured substantial capital from top-tier VCs, Unicorn and Decacorn founders, and industry experts through various funding rounds, we are well-funded and expanding our team.

The Tech team allows you to work alongside a group of highly ambitious and knowledgeable professionals while tackling complex data-centric problems.

Tasks


Data Modelling & Analysis: Develop and maintain the company’s BI structure and conduct in-depth analysis to extract meaningful insights and trends. Create dashboards reports and visualisations that support business decision-making processes.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders across various departments to understand their data needs and deliver actionable intelligence. Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data reporting and analysis.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics to track the performance of various business processes. Provide regular performance updates and insights to senior management and other stakeholders.
Data Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data used for analysis and reporting. Develop and implement data validation and cleansing processes to maintain high data quality standards.
Market and Customer Insights: Analyse market trends and customer behaviour to identify opportunities for business growth and optimization. Provide insights into customer segmentation, buying patterns, and product performance.
Tool and System Management: Utilise BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, and Databricks) to manage and analyse data. Continuously improve and optimise the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities.
Innovation and Best Practices: Stay current with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics. Implement innovative solutions to improve data analysis and reporting processes.


Requirements


Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is preferred.
Proven Experience: Extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting. Proven track record of delivering actionable insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and SQL. Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks.
Analytical Skills: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights.
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Strong ability to present data insights and recommendations to diverse audiences.
Attention to Detail: High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes.
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organisation.


Benefits


Impactful Work: Small team, flat hierarchy, mission-driven. We’re small, lean, and passionate about our work. Your contributions will have a direct impact on providing insights that drive business decisions and strategies.
Modern Tech Stack: Work with a modern tech stack, including CI/CD with GitHub Actions and AWS infrastructure. Hands-on experience with tools like Python, SQL, Postgres, Kinesis, Databricks, and Terraform.
Freedom to Experiment: Enjoy the freedom to experiment with new data technologies and methodologies during our hack days/weeks.
Growth Opportunity: Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs and experienced executives.


Join us and leverage your analytical skills to drive insights and reshape a major industry with innovative data solutions that make a difference!

Internal job reference: 0e6d15b6-35d7-4a67-9401-e67f02a0f5ef

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office


LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge that gives you the chance to use your knowledge and passion for Data Analysis to take Customer Insights at Selfridges to the next level? Looking for a company that wants to help further your career as well as provide you with an exciting, inspiring, and fun place to work?

If the answer to all of these questions is ‘yes’ then you’re just the kind of person we’re looking for!

Selfridges has a brilliant opportunity within the Customer Analytics Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Analytics Manager. As a Customer Data Analyst, you will have the exciting and rare chance to work in a fast-paced environment, to help us take our business to the next level

THE ROLE

As a Customer Analyst, some of your main responsibilities will be:

Provide weekly and monthly reports on key customer KPIs understand the drivers of their performance
Providing actionable insights of the back of analysis completed on customer and transactional data, using SQL.
Work with fellow analysts to create accessible, relevant, and actionable reports and Power BI dashboards, using multiple sources of data.
Own projects end-to-end and manage the process.
Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

SQL knowledges and experience building Power BI or Salesforce Einstein Analytics dashboards – Already experience using Power BI is a bonus
Proven experience dealing with large, complex datasets of different varieties (e.g. digital data, transactional data, marketing data) and evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables and aggregation of data
Time management skills: Ability to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.
Passionate about the customer - you are passionate about improving the customer experience through delivering actionable insight
Impeccable attention to detail
A passion for solving new problems, learning new skills and furthering your understanding along the way.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The GBS Analytics team partners with an array of cross-functional departments to provide bespoke analytics solutions to their needs, both internally and externally facing. Your work will play a guiding role in shaping decision-making around advertising strategy iteration and how we communicate this with our clients.

Role Overview
- This position will have a day-to-day focus on providing analytical and strategic guidance to TikTok's Ads Business with the primary objective of enabling Sales teams to make effective and data driven decisions
- The insight and analytics produced by this role will be shared with Sales and Product leadership to shape decision making and Advertiser Marketing Strategies on TikTok
- The role will interact and work with multiple cross-functional partners including GBS, Product, Marketing Science, Research & Insights and Strategy Teams
- This is an individual contributor position with high value impact to our business.

Responsibilities
- Conduct analysis using internal and external data (e.g. Customer, Revenue, Product, Market and Industry) to derive insights that will drive business decisions
- Develop deep understanding of TikToks Ads business, analysing business and product trends (incl. regional, channel and vertical performance), synthesise and communicate insights in a comprehensible way
- Identify opportunities throughout the marketing funnel to improve Advertiser acquisition, growth and retention opportunities and present recommendations to key decision makers
- Work effectively with cross-functional teams, driving results through extracting actionable insights and building strategic partnerships with key stakeholders
- Conceptualise, build, manage and maintain tools (incl. dashboards) that GBS teams can use to extract data and insights for daily business management in an automated manner

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Experience analysing and deriving meaning from unstructured datasets
- Experience using both qualitative analysis (e.g. Hypothesis testing) and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g. Descriptive analysis)
- Experience in database interrogation and analysis tools, such as Apache Hadoop, SQL and SAS
- Experience in Data Visualisation tools, such as Power BI or Tableau
- Demonstrated problem solving experience with experience driving and delivering action based on data-driven insights and recommendations from data analyses
- Experience with digital advertising or ads monetisation

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience in a tech or scaling business environment
- Experience in a professional sales environment

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.’s brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst



Salary: £50,000 - £60,000



Location: London, Hybrid



Data Idols is collaborating with a large, worldwide publishing company, continuously expanding its product and service range. This company is on an exciting growth trajectory, publishing significant research that has the potential to enhance society. With the aim of improving people's lives through books and journals at the heart of their business, they are searching for a Data Analyst to introduce new, innovative methods to the team.






The Opportunity



In this thrilling role as a Data Analyst, you will be pioneering data analysis to support and refine key reports and dashboards that are crucial for decision-making across the company. This is an opportunity to not only contribute to the data culture and drive efficiency in various analytic projects but also to engage with internal teams and present these findings.



What's in it for you?


Up to £60k
Hybrid working


Skills and Experience



Including key requirements helps you to deter irrelevant candidates from applying for your role. We would also recommend making your key requirements screening questions:

Experience working wit SQL
Expereince working with Python
Experience with working with visulisation tools, preferably Power BI

If you would like to be considered for the role and feel you would be an ideal fit with our team then please send your CV to us by clicking on the Apply button below.


Desired Skills and Experience

SQL|Power BI|Python

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - £30k-£45k (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: £30k-£60k – London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.




All candidates must have the full right to work in the UK!




Responsibilities:

Collect and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner




Requirements:

Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
Advanced Excel skills
Power BI
Python (Desirable)
Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities




Benefits:

Competitive bonus scheme




If the above role is of interest and you’ve got the required experience, apply with your most up to date CV for immediate consideration and interview!




Alternatively, if you would like to find out more about the position, reach out to me on 020 3920 8833 or at ethan.chesterfield@intechnologygroup.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role. This is an opportunity to work collaboratively.




Responsibilities:




Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all our product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich our internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
Track KPIs of our systems and processes.




Qualifications:




Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK’s leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketing Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on campaign performance; supporting the marketing and CRM teams to run experiments to improve UX and monetization, and building analytics to support the leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:


Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Skills We'd Love You To Have


You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills


Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Someone joins ClearScore every 20 seconds. We have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders in the U.K., and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.

Since October 2016 we have helped 1.8 million users take out a new credit card or loan. We are user-centric at our core and we believe in leveraging technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data-driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.

Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and we believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.

If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.

Benefits:


25 paid holidays and a “duvet day” on your birthday
Hybrid Work Environment: flexible work-life balance allowing you to thrive both in the office and from the comfort of your own space.
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular well-being events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives
Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan


Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.
Show more
HTML:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK’s leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketing Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on campaign performance; supporting the marketing and CRM teams to run experiments to improve UX and monetization, and building analytics to support the leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:

  • Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
  • Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
  • Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
  • Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
  • Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals

Skills We'd Love You To Have

  • You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
  • Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
  • Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload
  • You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
  • You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
  • Strong quantitative and numerical skills

Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Description:

Duration : 6 months initial contract with potential extensions

Data Analyst

Via Umbrella




Our Life and Pensions client require a Data Analyst to help support on an exciting project for an initial 6-month contract.

Automation of data processes

Sharepoint
