Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to £70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business that’s fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
NBFI (Non-Banking Financial Institution) Data Analyst

Fitch Group is currently seeking an NBFI Data Analyst based out of our London office.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

The Data Analyst will be part of our Data Operations team responsible for collection and extraction of all fundamental data needed across Fitch Group.

Candidates will be required to analyse and maintain data for NBFI entities within Fitch systems. More specifically they will be required to interpret financial data from annual and other periodic reports, to ensure data is extracted from the balance sheet, income statement and associated notes in line with Fitch methodology. Candidates will also be required to support client queries on this data as they arise.

What We Offer


This is a great chance to join a growing team responsible for Fitch’s fundamental data collection, supporting Ratings and Solutions.
Exposure to the latest technology, as processes are transformed to leverage AI/ML.


We’ll Count On You To


Analyse financial data to ensure information from annual or periodical reports has been collected in line with Fitch methodology
Communicate effectively with Internal and external stakeholders on financial data decisions and queries via email, on the phone or face to face
Proactively make recommendations on process improvements to the data capture/ quality assurance process, and assist with the implementation of new processes, through training and documentation updates.


What You Need To Have


A sound knowledge of accounting practices to interpret all aspects of a financial report, ideally qualified to a degree standard in accountancy or business studies.
Prior experience working with financial statement fundamental data preferred.
A second language would be advantageous.


What Would Make You Stand Out


Excellent administration and communication skills.
Must have a highly organised and methodical approach to work.
To be a self-starter who can pick up new processes quickly and accurately.
Can work effectively within a team environment.
Have a can-do attitude to problems.


Why Fitch?

At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.

Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority. We are building incredible things at Fitch, and we invite you to join us on our journey.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

For More Information, Please Visit Our Websites

www.fitchratings.com | www.fitchsolutions.com | www.fitchlearning.com

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interest or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.

Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.




About The Role




As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager




You will:

You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible




About You




The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience




You will also;

Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data




About Us




Harrods is one of the world’s leading luxury department stores and we’re becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world’s most inspiring shopping experiences.




Our Promise to You




Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we’ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.




In return, you’ll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days’ holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.




Uniquely You




At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.




If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.




Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: £30,000 - £35,000




Join a pioneering London-based Financial Services company that is transforming the insurance landscape with innovative solutions. With a remarkable access to funding secured in the last 6 months, this Series-A funded company is poised for exponential growth and is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team.




Role Overview:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting complex data to help shape the future of financial technology. Your insights will drive key business decisions and contribute to the development of cutting-edge investment products. This position offers the flexibility of working fully remotely while being part of an exciting and fast-paced environment.




Qualifications:

- Bachelor's or Master's from a russell group university, and a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

- Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL




Benefits:

- Performance-based bonus

- Private health and dental insurance

- Stock options

- Opportunity to work in a fully-remote position

- Be part of a fast-growing company with significant funding and growth potential




How to Apply:

If you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst looking to make a significant impact in the Financial Services industry, we would love to hear from you. Please click apply for immediate consideration

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

We're the leading social media agency in the business of spinning heads and stopping thumbs. We unleash the value of social for brands by combining expertise in data-driven strategy, innovative social campaigns, industry-leading creative, authentic content, and performance marketing to deliver measurable results. Founded by Max Whicher and Alex Bodini in 2016, Spin now boasts a team of over 50 proud social natives who deliver 360 social campaigns for global brands, including Google, Bupa, Ann Summers, Universal Music, Fujifilm, and Napolina.




We are a diverse group of creators, analysts, specialists, enthusiasts, deep-thinkers and boundary-pushers. And, of course, we can't forget about Data Analysts, and that’s where you come in!




Our blend of passion and fun has garnered us multiple awards for creating a fantastic workplace.

(This is where we brag about being recognised as one of the 'Top 100 Best Places to Work')




You can see more of what we're about at spinbrands.com and take a peek at our smiling faces on our 'About Us' page.




The Role

Less about us, more about you.

Ready to join our dynamic and rapidly expanding Performance team?

Join us as a Data Analyst and be at the forefront of the data-driven revolution in marketing! Reporting directly to the Performance Director, you’ll be contributing to our rapid growth and success. You'll dive deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape campaigns. If you're keen to kickstart your career in a vibrant, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!




Here’s what you’ll be doing...

Data Integrations through Funnel: Our analytics platform has hundreds of millions of data points that we use to guide our understanding of campaign performance. You'll work on integrating data from multiple sources through Funnel, ensuring that the data is accurate and accessible for analysis. - We need you to help us understand!
Report Creation and Maintenance: You'll create and maintain Looker Studio reports that provide valuable insights that are crucial for decision-making within the organisation on a daily basis. Your role will include making continual improvements to ensure the reports are as accurate and useful as possible. - Get as creative as you’d like!
Experimentation: (Not in a science lab we promise) Running structured experiments is a key part of how the Spin team works across paid and organic social. You’ll be responsible for identifying testing opportunities, working with account managers to implement them, managing rewards from advertising partners, and communicating test results.
Data analysis: Our team helps answer the most fundamental questions in marketing: is it working, and why. We use incrementality studies to understand the impact our marketing efforts are having on our clients’ businesses, and deep-dive into trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks - You love the details, the nitty gritty, you probably wanted to be a detective when you were younger!
Tracking: Our analysis relies on good quality data. You'll be responsible for helping our clients track events across various platforms. This will often involve auditing tracking setup, building tracking maps and helping our clients troubleshoot.




Here’s what we need from you...

You'll be highly proficient in using spreadsheets, as they will be a fundamental tool in your day-to-day responsibilities - Spreadsheets are what dreams are made of!
The ability analyse data to answer questions and surface insights to a high standard, and present them visually and clearly
You'll be part of a team and may need to present your findings, so the ability to communicate clearly and effectively is crucial - We don’t bite!
Given that you'll be handling data and generating reports, a keen eye for detail is essential to ensure the accuracy and reliability of your work
Knowledge of how marketing data works is critical to the success of this role - It’s a complex game and we love it!
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python would be highly desirable and give you a significant advantage in performing more complex data analyses.
Previous experience working with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, and Google Analytics would make you stand out as a candidate. Familiarity with any paid media management tools would also be a plus.
Knowledge and experience running A/B test and reporting your findings to the team
A keen interest in the emerging trends and technologies of AI and using it to measure metrics for organic and paid social
An excellent understanding of how paid social and organic social analysis can be applied to campaigns - The best of both worlds!




The Perks

A chance to play a part and make a difference in a young, rapidly developing agency whilst building your career.
Celebrate the company’s wins with our bonus scheme - earn up to an impressive 20% additional salary. Cha-ching!
Embrace the freedom of our flexi-working policy. No need to ask permission; grab your laptop, kick back in your favourite spot, and let the productivity flow from the comforts of home.
Explore the world with our remote working policy, allowing you to work from anywhere (yes, even abroad!) for a whole month each year.
Enjoy a well-deserved 25 days of holiday
Look after your mental health with access to Spill Chat, a support app that connects you with real-life therapists.
Look forward to Fridays with 4 PM finishes. Start your weekend early and recharge those batteries.
Put your health as a #1 priority with our excellent healthcare package.
Bond with the team with team outings, monthly social events, and an epic annual trip. We know how to have fun; trust us.




At Spin, we foster a vibrant work environment that thrives on diverse perspectives and creative ideas. As strong advocates for inclusion and representation, we actively encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, disability, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age.

Beyond compliance, we take pride in building a dynamic work environment that fosters creativity and champions inclusion, diversity, and representation.

Show more
HTML:
About Us

We're the leading social media agency in the business of spinning heads and stopping thumbs. We unleash the value of social for brands by combining expertise in data-driven strategy, innovative social campaigns, industry-leading creative, authentic content, and performance marketing to deliver measurable results. Founded by Max Whicher and Alex Bodini in 2016, Spin now boasts a team of over 50 proud social natives who deliver 360 social campaigns for global brands, including Google, Bupa, Ann Summers, Universal Music, Fujifilm, and Napolina.


We are a diverse group of creators, analysts, specialists, enthusiasts, deep-thinkers and boundary-pushers. And, of course, we can't forget about Data Analysts, and that’s where you come in!


Our blend of passion and fun has garnered us multiple awards for creating a fantastic workplace.

(This is where we brag about being recognised as one of the 'Top 100 Best Places to Work')


You can see more of what we're about at spinbrands.com and take a peek at our smiling faces on our 'About Us' page.


The Role

Less about us, more about you.

Ready to join our dynamic and rapidly expanding Performance team?

Join us as a Data Analyst and be at the forefront of the data-driven revolution in marketing! Reporting directly to the Performance Director, you’ll be contributing to our rapid growth and success. You'll dive deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape campaigns. If you're keen to kickstart your career in a vibrant, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!


Here’s what you’ll be doing...

  • Data Integrations through Funnel: Our analytics platform has hundreds of millions of data points that we use to guide our understanding of campaign performance. You'll work on integrating data from multiple sources through Funnel, ensuring that the data is accurate and accessible for analysis. - We need you to help us understand!
  • Report Creation and Maintenance: You'll create and maintain Looker Studio reports that provide valuable insights that are crucial for decision-making within the organisation on a daily basis. Your role will include making continual improvements to ensure the reports are as accurate and useful as possible. - Get as creative as you’d like!
  • Experimentation: (Not in a science lab we promise) Running structured experiments is a key part of how the Spin team works across paid and organic social. You’ll be responsible for identifying testing opportunities, working with account managers to implement them, managing rewards from advertising partners, and communicating test results.
  • Data analysis: Our team helps answer the most fundamental questions in marketing: is it working, and why. We use incrementality studies to understand the impact our marketing efforts are having on our clients’ businesses, and deep-dive into trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks - You love the details, the nitty gritty, you probably wanted to be a detective when you were younger!
  • Tracking: Our analysis relies on good quality data. You'll be responsible for helping our clients track events across various platforms. This will often involve auditing tracking setup, building tracking maps and helping our clients troubleshoot.


Here’s what we need from you...

  • You'll be highly proficient in using spreadsheets, as they will be a fundamental tool in your day-to-day responsibilities - Spreadsheets are what dreams are made of!
  • The ability analyse data to answer questions and surface insights to a high standard, and present them visually and clearly
  • You'll be part of a team and may need to present your findings, so the ability to communicate clearly and effectively is crucial - We don’t bite!
  • Given that you'll be handling data and generating reports, a keen eye for detail is essential to ensure the accuracy and reliability of your work
  • Knowledge of how marketing data works is critical to the success of this role - It’s a complex game and we love it!
  • Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python would be highly desirable and give you a significant advantage in performing more complex data analyses.
  • Previous experience working with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, and Google Analytics would make you stand out as a candidate. Familiarity with any paid media management tools would also be a plus.
  • Knowledge and experience running A/B test and reporting your findings to the team
  • A keen interest in the emerging trends and technologies of AI and using it to measure metrics for organic and paid social
  • An excellent understanding of how paid social and organic social analysis can be applied to campaigns - The best of both worlds!


The Perks

  • A chance to play a part and make a difference in a young, rapidly developing agency whilst building your career.
  • Celebrate the company’s wins with our bonus scheme - earn up to an impressive 20% additional salary. Cha-ching!
  • Embrace the freedom of our flexi-working policy. No need to ask permission; grab your laptop, kick back in your favourite spot, and let the productivity flow from the comforts of home.
  • Explore the world with our remote working policy, allowing you to work from anywhere (yes, even abroad!) for a whole month each year.
  • Enjoy a well-deserved 25 days of holiday
  • Look after your mental health with access to Spill Chat, a support app that connects you with real-life therapists.
  • Look forward to Fridays with 4 PM finishes. Start your weekend early and recharge those batteries.
  • Put your health as a #1 priority with our excellent healthcare package.
  • Bond with the team with team outings, monthly social events, and an epic annual trip. We know how to have fun; trust us.


At Spin, we foster a vibrant work environment that thrives on diverse perspectives and creative ideas. As strong advocates for inclusion and representation, we actively encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, disability, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age.

Beyond compliance, we take pride in building a dynamic work environment that fosters creativity and champions inclusion, diversity, and representation.

Title: Graduate Insight Analyst
Description:
Introduction

In this role, you will be working in our B2C function working primarily in the acquisition insights team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team of supportive and highly collaborative insights specialists, data scientists and engineers.

You will work across a multitude of projects ranging from supporting monthly reporting, working with senior analysts to deliver insights projects and help analyse test results. You will be part of a team who delivers tangible difference and whose work impacts day to day decision making at The Economist.

We are looking for a candidate who is curious, looking to learn new skills and with an aptitude for insight. Experience working with analytics data or other large data sets using SQL or other languages is advantageous but not essential and candidates looking to develop their technical skills are also welcomed.

Accountabilities


Working closely with senior analysts and other members of the team to deliver insights work to product and marketing stakeholders.
Supporting the team across a variety of different tasks ranging from reporting, to deep dive insights projects and testing.
Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts.
Become an expert in how The Economist acquires new subscribers and how we can optimise our channels and platforms.
Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities.


Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes


Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
Experience working with datasets
Some familiarity with analytics systems
A proactive approach to problem solving


The following would also be advantageous but not required:


Experience using SQL for data analysis
Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London 🌆




Remuneration: Hourly rate £35.58 💸




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ⌛




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ⏰




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. 📈




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. 🌟




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ✨




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.💼




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Title: Data Analyst, Benefits - London
HTML:
Responsibilities

 About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
Performance & Incentives (P&I) are powerful tools for furthering the company's strategic goals. A robust P&I strategy influences the organization's ability to attract and retain the best talent, while creating a strong alignment of individuals' interests with the organization's strategic goals. The P&I Team at ByteDance, therefore, are constantly benchmarking and striving for the best practice & return on investment in developing competitive C&B policies. The P&I Team works on a lot of interesting problems. Whether it is developing new world-class compensation policies, diving deep into market research, analyzing big data and benchmarking. The P&I Team work on a lot of cool and exciting projects to come up with the best ways to serve our organization. Given the nature of our work, it also creates huge opportunities for collaboration with departments in and outside of the HR organization.

Parts of this role will require providing support across ByteDance, as well as TikTok. ByteDance is TikTok's parent company, whose mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life.

What You Will Do:
- Contribute towards the ongoing rollout of ByteDance's global benefits strategy, and improve outcomes for 27 countries in EMEA through building and optimising the team's decision-making processes;
- Leading and executing local and regional benefits projects end-to-end using analytical methods including, but not limited to, data mining, industry research, user research, etc;
- Identify, define and help to prioritise benefits projects to empower the team to reach goals effectively;
- Manage critical benefits vendor relationships and building performance tracking systems;
- Developing strategic partnerships and negotiate commercial terms.

Qualifications

 Minimium Qualifications
- Experienced in people/human resource analysis, or business/data analysis;
- Fluency in English;
- Proven in report writing skills, be able to do proposals based on research and analysis, which are presentable to stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications
- Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in a human resource, business or data analytics capacity;
- Knowledge and experience in SQL, Python or SPSS is an advantage;
- Self-motivation and curiosity, fast-learning to discover the relationship between data and human resources policies;
- Strong communication skills in English;
- Experienced working in fast-paced environment, preferably in a tech firm.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
ESG Data Analyst - Data Science - Investment Management - up to £110,000




Our client, a leading Investment Management organisation based in the City of London, are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to join them on a permanent basis. You will be joining the ESG Data team and assist in the development of a Data Science model.




The successful candidate will be responsible for progressing the automation of ESG data production, analysis and systematic integration with other systems currently being utilised by the business. Alongside this, you will be enhancing ESG data through improving data quality and transparency as well as devising innovative approaches for ESG data analytics and insights through building robust data orientated solutions in Python.




The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset and demonstrate strong problem solving skills. You will also have experience working within Investment Management or a similarly regulated industry.




Key Skills:

3-7 years experience working as an ESG Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of Python and building data orientated solutions for businesses.
Knowledge of ESG metrics is highly beneficial.
Experience working with modern data tools (e.g. Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas etc.)
Exposure to machine learning approaches such as neural networks and generative AI is desirable
Experienced working in the Investment Management industry

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Keyrus Group is a trusted leader in Data Intelligence with 27 years’ worth of experience, over 3,200 consultants and offices across the globe in 26 countries. Our expert teams provide strategic data engineering, data analytics, and data science solutions for our clients, primarily in the financial services, utilities and energy industries.

The Keyrus UK team is expanding rapidly. Our team has doubled in the last 12 months and is continuing to grow! If you are looking to join an innovative company that has the support of an internationally recognised brand, we encourage you to apply.

The Opportunity

Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialized in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 20 countries on 4 continents.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in utilizing Alation and Experian platforms to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business decisions.

Responsibilities


Utilize Alation and Experian platforms to gather, organize, and analyze large volumes of data.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical results.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and support special projects as required.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics, Alation, and Experian technologies.


What We're Looking For In Our Applicants


Proven experience working as a Data Analyst with specific experience using Alation and Experian platforms.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with data governance and metadata management is a plus.


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Keyrus UK Benefits


Competitive holiday allowance
Very comprehensive Private Medical Plan
Flexible working patterns
Workplace Pension Scheme
Sodexo Lifestyle Benefits
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Referral Bonus Scheme
Training & Development via KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:

Develop and implement quantitative models.
Analyse large datasets to identify patterns and opportunities.
Collaborate with the research team to improve algorithmic performance.
Conduct back testing of algorithms to validate their effectiveness.
Optimize existing algorithms for better performance and lower latency.
Communicate findings and insights to the team through detailed reports.




Requirements




Education:

Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science.




Experience:

Experience in developing and implementing quantitative models.
Strong background in statistical analysis and probability theory.
Proficiency in Python (experience with libraries such as NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.).




Skills:

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data analysis.
Excellent communication skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications:

A Master’s degree or PhD in one of the related fields.
Familiarity with other programming languages such as C++, R, or MATLAB.
Experience with machine learning techniques and frameworks.
Familiarity with data processing tools and environments.

Title: Tableau Data Analyst
Company: Sphere Digital Recruitment | Best Small Company 2022
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Tableau Data Analyst - Agency - (£35,000 - £40,000)

The Company

Exciting opportunity to join a multi-award winning digital agency. Play a lead role optimising performance marketing and campaign analytics.

You'll be looking after multiple projects utilising your expertise in in building Tableau dashboards, delivering complex digital data insights in simple terms to senior clients and stakeholders to optimse performance of media campaigns.

This is a great opportunity to work for a business renowned for the well-being policies, flexible working and incredible social and fun working environment.

The Job

Work with stakeholders, clients on KPIs and metrics to build dashboards to optimise their media mix and channel performance

Analyse client's campaign data and proposed the next steps and phases to acceleratedata informed decisions

Create self-serve reporting dashboards using tools such as SQL and Tableau

Work with the likes of Tesco, cruise.com and many more


You

Strong proficiency with SQL & Tableau
Ideally experience with Python, Bigquery or cloud technologies
Experience with media or digital data and/or agency background would be a plus

Apply Now

You can apply for this role now by sending us your CV or by calling us now! Don't forget to look at vacancies on our website and register as a candidate.

Jordan Matthews

Senior Consultant

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🌟 Data Insight Analyst at top Lloyd's market Insurer🌟




Excellent Salary + Bonus + 31 days holiday + Excellent Benefits

Hybrid working: London Office (2/3 days a week in the office)




Are you passionate about data analysis, visualization, and driving business insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment? Look no further! Our Lloyds Market Insurer customer is seeking a talented and creative Data Insights Analyst to work directly with teams across the business to deliver the information they need.




This is an organization at the forefront of cutting-edge data services, capturing, transforming, and analyzing diverse data through their modern cloud-based platform, generating invaluable insights for their business. Now needing a Data Analyst to take this to the next level!




As the successful Data Insights Analyst you will need:




Essential skills:

Power BI report development (including DAX).
Transact SQL and Python/Scala scripting.
Stakeholder management and requirements capture.
General analytical and modeling techniques.
Data visualization and dashboard design.




Desirable:

Understanding of Lloyd’s Insurance market data.
Experience with Agile processes.
Data quality management expertise.
Familiarity with modern data processing technologies (data lakes, warehouses, reporting tools).
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure data and analytics tools (including Azure Databricks).




Role Highlights:

Hands-On Impact: Dive into data, collaborating directly with cross-functional teams to deliver critical information.
Analytical Skills: Design repeatable reports and create ad-hoc analyses to drive data-driven decisions.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with business teams, bringing their ideas back to the data team.
Continuous Learning: Explore new skills and innovative ways to analyze and visualize data.




Responsibilities:

Understand data requirements from colleagues across the business
Prioritize work within the Data Insights team.
Contribute to Agile project delivery.
Develop reporting and visualization solutions.
Collaborate on data engineering and architecture requirements.
Uphold data standards and governance.
Coach colleagues in data analysis self-service.
Monitor data quality and raise awareness of best practices.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and your application will be reviewed swiftly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join an insurtech, scale-up company with a fantastic culture and great branding.
Sit under the Head of Analytics.
Faced paced business with a strong data maturity.




Join a fast-paced scale up with an exciting USP and an amazing team!




What you’ll be doing

Sitting in the retention tribe in this exciting company, you’ll be working to better understand customers. You’ll be helping customers who struggle to get fair car insurance, and then you’ll be helping the company to retain those customers.




You’ll be using customer data to better understand when and how to best communicate with their customers; better understand who the customers are and why they’re buying from the company. You’ll be diving into the customer experience to understand the customer lifetime value, looking at marketing analysis and better understand the customer demographic by diving into trends and patterns.




They’ve got a high-performance culture and amazing career opportunities while also having low egos throughout their cross functional teams. Unlike others, this insurance company prides themselves on having great customer service and an incredibly data driven environment. This company are revolutionising insurance by introducing technology driven environments into the insurance world. Want to be part of the revolution? You’ll join a mature data team and help to bridge a gap in the team during a transition of one of their main team members, you’ll be coming in to assist with the handover and fast paced work.




What experience you’ll need to apply

3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Excellent SQL experience
Looker experience
Ideally experience with DBT, or a similar data modelling tool
Experience with Snowflake
Experience working in start-ups/scale-up companies
Ideally working in a fintech or insurtech




What you’ll get in return for your experience

They’re offering a salary of up to £84,000 for the right person, plus bonus and excellent benefits! Please note there is a requirement of two days a week in the office.




What next

Apply using the above link or send your CV over to Tegan!

Show more

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Who we are:

Apollo is an independent specialist (re)insurer launched in 2009 to provide high quality products and services to clients, brokers, and capital partners at Lloyd’s. The Apollo name recognised the success of one of its founding investors Neil Armstrong, who in 1969 was the first person to land on the moon. Along with Jim Hays, Neil saw the opportunity to build a differentiated service provider at Lloyd’s.

Having started life in 2009 as Apollo Syndicate 1969, we have since developed a diverse offering of insurance solutions for our clients and partners, ranging from traditional and specialty lines to innovative sharing economy solutions, and managing agency services at Lloyd’s. We are excited to continue growing our team of more than 250 colleagues who strive towards our collective purpose of enabling a resilient and sustainable world.

“We attract and retain the highest quality talent by developing a team atmosphere where opportunity exists for our employees and partners.” David Ibeson, Group CEO

Your Role:

Apollo is establishing a set of truly innovative data services to propel our business to the next level. We are capturing, transforming, and analysing a vast variety of data through a modern cloud-based data platform to produce fabulously rich insight for our business. However, we need an enthusiastic, skilful, and creative Data Insights Analyst to join the team to make this happen!

This role will be a key part of the Data Insights team by getting hands-on with our data and collaborating directly with teams across the business to deliver the information they need. You will need to bring the best of your data analysis skills to deliver this, either through designing repeatable reports or creating ad-hoc pieces of analysis and analytics projects.

By working directly with the business, you will be in the perfect place to listen to their thoughts and ideas and be able to bring them back into our wider data team. Here you will work with the rest of the Data Insights team as well as data engineers and other data specialists to drive the next versions of our data services.

The data space is ever evolving so there will also be lots of opportunity to gain experience, new skills and try innovative ways to analyse and visualise our information.

What you’ll do:


Work with colleges across Apollo under understand their requirements for data analysis and management information.
Contribute to the prioritisation of work within the team.
Work as part of an Agile delivery process to complete both BAU and project work within the Data Insights team
Use the team’s tools for work tracking and version control to make sure all finished work is supportable.
Develop reporting, analysis, and data visualisation solutions as part of a companywide MI portfolio.
Where requirements need wider data engineering and architecture support, document requirements and design information to be communicated into the wider team.
Challenge where requests for reporting and analysis go against our company data strategy or deviate from our data standards and processes.
Use your skills and data knowledge to coach, train, and support colleagues in the adoption of data analysis self-service.
Set expectations for and monitor data quality within reports and analysis, feeding back to the wider data function when anomalies are found.
Work within our data governance processes to implement common data definitions and best practices.
Understand how business processes can affect data quality via key source systems and help raise awareness to colleagues with data ownership responsibilities.
Keep our colleagues aware of the latest developments and capabilities in the Data Solutions, Data Insights, and wider data community.


What we are looking for:


Power BI report development including DAX.
Transact SQL and Python/Scala Scripting
Stakeholder management skills including requirements capture.
General analytical and modelling techniques
General data visualization and dashboard design techniques


What you will get in return:

As well as your salary, this role offers a discretionary bonus plus a broad range of benefits, including Non-Contributory Pension, Private Medical & Travel Insurance.

Our Commitment to Inclusion:

Apollo is a growing and diverse team of empowered and passionate experts who focus on bringing innovation, data driven decision making and collaboration to every relationship and every risk. To meet the needs of a demanding global insurance market, we need a diverse workforce that truly understands the international communities we serve.

That is why we're focused on developing diverse talent at every level; inclusion and diversity means more to us than just chasing a target and we are committed to supporting and celebrating difference. Our people are at the heart of our business which is why we value the diversity of thought and talent of every member of our team.

We offer a range of support and run a programme of events and training that recognise the challenges and opportunities relating to diversity.

Hybrid & flexible working:

At Apollo, hybrid and flexible working is fully embraced and we do not see the benefit of presenteeism. We understand that no two colleagues are alike, and as such we support the ability to remain agile and achieve a home and work balance to best suit business and personal commitments.

Supporting your application

We want everyone to have equal access to our recruitment and selection processes so please take a few moments to complete our Candidate profile to identify any support or adjustments you may require during the recruitment process https://cleartalents.com/apply/Apollo-tv1680005409/

Thank you!

To find out more about our values, ESG strategy and commitment to inclusion please click on the 'Life at Apollo Pack’ link at the bottom of our careers page https://apollounderwriting.com/careers/

Title: Policy Data Analyst
Description:
About Logistics UK

As one of the country's largest business groups, Logistics UK employs evidence-based thought leadership and strategic engagement with policy makers to drive logistics up the agenda and to boost the UK's ambitions for the future of our sector. This includes engaging closely with ministers and senior officials across government departments, as well as devolved governments and regional authorities.

On behalf of our members, we promote key agendas for logistics from innovative and integrated infrastructure, a fair transition to a green economy, skills partnerships to support a thriving sector, trade as a driver of innovation and productivity, and championing what logistics delivers for households, public services, businesses and the economy every day.

Job Summary

Logistics UK is looking to appoint an Economic Data Analyst who is excited about using their analytical expertise and gaining hands-on experience of the representational and information work of a business group. We are looking for someone to provide robust economic analysis and insights that underpin Logistics UK's policy positions, enabling the organisation to influence key stakeholders and shape the future of the logistics sector. This role will support the policy team in strategic initiatives and maintain the essential flow of intelligence that informs our advocacy and member services.

This role will be based within our Policy Information Team but will offer experiential insights into the work of our Policy and Public Affairs Teams and the campaigning work of a major trade association. Our analyst role is an exciting opportunity to be at the heart of Logistics UK's Policy Team, representing the interests of companies in this vibrant sector.

Responsibilities


Data management and reporting: You will oversee the economics database and daily indicators, ensuring high standards of accuracy and relevance. Generate insightful reports and analyses from internal and external data sources for publications, media and member briefings
Policy analysis: You will conduct economic, fiscal, and impact analysis to support Logistics UK's policy positions.
Strategic project support: You will aid in the development and delivery of strategic projects, such as the Productivity Report and executive membership activities, which require a blend of analytical acumen and strategic thought
Member engagement and service delivery: You will engage with members to provide tailored economic insights and support the execution of high-level briefings and events
Collaboration and influence: You will work in tandem with policy, public affairs, and marketing teams to enhance Logistics UK's position as a leader in economic matters within the sector
Team: You will undertake other responsibilities commensurate with your role as required by the Deputy Director - Policy Information



Requirements


Analytical excellence: You will have exceptional quantitative skills, with proficiency in statistical software and Excel, to handle complex data sets and time series analytical skills
Communication: You will have strong written and verbal communication skills to articulate economic concepts clearly to non-specialists and influence internal and external stakeholders
Collaborative working: You will have demonstrable ability to work effectively as part of a team, contributing to a cooperative work environment
Proactivity and initiative: Eagerness to take on new challenges, suggest improvements, and drive forward projects
Communication skills: You will have excellent writing skills in relation to the production of in-house reports, briefings and publications. Clear and concise presentational, communication and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written.
Other skills: You will have the ability to work autonomously, prioritise and organise work and manage project workstreams to ensure deadlines are met. High attention to detail.



Qualifications


A degree in a numerate discipline or a discipline with a high numerate content, such as economics, data analysis, or statistics is required. A postgraduate degree is desirable but not essential



Desirable Skills And Experience


Experience in economic or data analysis or a related field, with a track record of applying analytical skills in a business or policy environment


Personal development and growth


The role provides a unique opportunity to deepen knowledge of the logistics sector and its economic and data analysis
Active involvement in high-profile projects offers a platform for professional growth and sectoral influence



Benefits

We value our employees and offer a wide range of benefits recognising that no two employees are the same - everyone has different preferences and needs that change over time.


25 days of annual leave plus bank holidays
Christmas Working Arrangement for extra days off during the festive period
Health Cash Plan for all employees and Private Medical Insurance for managers
Employee Assistance Programme and Mental Health First Aiders
Enhanced Family Leave policy
Flexible and remote working arrangements
Two paid days off per year for charity or volunteering work
Various learning and development opportunities
Range of pension schemes
Award scheme to recognise outstanding employees
Life Assurance Scheme for peace of mind
Show more

We value our employees and offer a wide range of benefits recognising that no two employees are the same - everyone has different preferences and needs that change over time.

  • Health Cash Plan for all employees and Private Medical Insurance for managers
  • Employee Assistance Programme and Mental Health First Aiders
  • Enhanced Family Leave policy
  • Flexible and remote working arrangements
  • Two paid days off per year for charity or volunteering work
  • Various learning and development opportunities
  • Range of pension schemes
  • Award scheme to recognise outstanding employees
  • Life Assurance Scheme for peace of mind

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading alcohol brand team of a leading global media agency with a large and innovative range of research solutions, to get close to client’s business and communication strategy, to work at a regional and global level with multiple markets, to gain exposure to new data analytics techniques and to build experience across different industries.

As a Data Analyst that owns a market leading portfolio, and you’ll support the team to maintain and build dashboards and various reporting tools. You will support the delivery of reporting solutions and any data analytics project paying particular attention to data governance and to the clients’ requirements.

Our team makes a very significant contribution to our agency’s income through work delivered to our clients, and we support nearly every new business pitch. We also develop simple but original ways to help our account teams interrogate performance and industry data sets to quickly answer key client questions – enabling our mission of Better Decisions, Faster, improving the standard of work on our accounts and giving our agency and clients a competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Balancing all of these competing priorities has become a huge challenge and could hinder our future growth. We need an efficient and pro-active individual to join us. We need help to focus on the right places so that we can deliver our commercial targets and also support the wider agency development roadmap.

Requirements


Experience using Business Intelligence platforms such as Datorama, Tableau or Power BI.
Proven working knowledge of data quality and reporting solutions .
Comfortable working with large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
You will provide support on answering ad-hoc queries from clients and internal client hub teams – supporting quality and effectiveness across all stages.
You will have direct relationships with our clients, for example as you help us to manage the actions from the weekly client status meetings.
Knowledge of coding languages including SQL, Python are preferable.
Knowledge of Datorama and looker studio is desirable.


At OMD EMEA, we strive to deliver on our promise of ‘better decisions, faster‘ for our clients, partners and all 6,000+ OMDers across our region every day. As part of the world’s largest media network, our business is staging experiences for consumers who have more choice and less attention than ever before. The key to the process is empathy. Empathy to see the world through the eyes of the consumer, to recognise the needs of our clients and to identify aspirations of our talent.

Learn Fast, Act Fast. To help navigate the road to a ‘new normal’, learning from, and acting upon data signals at scale and speed is crucial. Visit Why OMD? to learn more about our unique Act Fast Framework.

Be Your Best

We want everyone to make the most of the opportunity to shine and showcase your talents and we are happy to make adjustments in the recruitment process so you can be your best. Please discuss any specific requirements with your dedicated Talent Team member or if you would feel more comfortable, you can email us confidentially at beyourbest@omnicommediagroup.com to let us know how we can support you.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at OMG

At OMG, our vision is to be an agency where difference is valued and everyone is able to thrive in a culture of equality, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to providing a truly inclusive environment that reflects today’s society, where everyone is able to bring their true selves to work, and where diverse voices and backgrounds are valued, heard, and well-represented.

We will process your personal data in accordance with our Recruitment Privacy Notice which is available on https://omnicommediagroup.com/recruitment-privacy-notices/.

Title: Tableau Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a skilled, enthusiastic and proactive Data Analyst to join a great team in the Higher Education sector.




Higher Education experience is preferred, and must have Tableau experience/knowledge.




Main duties and responsibilities

As a member of the Insight team, your key responsibility will not only be to report on existing trends and ongoing performance but to identify and evaluate opportunities. To achieve this, you would be expected to be able to interpret and convert large complex data sets, using a range of methods and data transformation tools, create data visualisation, typically in Tableau and communicate key findings.




Using historical data and trends analysis, you will also be asked to create forecasts and models and summarise findings in easily digestible reports for decision making.




The Data Analyst would additionally undertake bespoke research and analyses in response to requests from the department.




Skill and experience required

Demonstrable experience of constructively challenging assumptions and traditional views, identifying issues and generating/implementing new, and adapting the tried and tested approaches to develop solutions to challenges and opportunities.




Demonstrable experience of using specialist analytical and reporting software or advanced functionality of Microsoft Excel, employing a range of practices to analyse and explain complex data sets. Demonstrable experience of using data visualisation software e.g. Tableau, Qlikview and Power BI to help uncover the stories behind the data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Purpose of Job:

To be responsible for:

i) Supporting the delivery of the data transformation requirements of the Supporting Families Programme (SFP)

ii) Supporting the data collection, analysis and reporting requirements relating to SFP

iii) Lead the data work (identification and case tracking) required to support the successful submission of payment by results (PBR) claims

Main Duties:


Work closely with the SF data lead and other key staff to being together the key data sources required to identify families that meet the SF criteria, and identify opportunities to tap into new data sources
Work with corporate data colleagues to develop technical solutions to matching large and complex datasets to track families’ progress against the SF outcomes framework
Lead on the live tracking of family progress and the completion of quarterly PBR returns to central government
Ensure robust auditing arrangements are in place that mean all PBR claims are made in accordance with audit and financial regulations
Support the wider use and analysis of data relating to the Supporting Families agenda, bringing together qualitative and quantitative data to progress the programme objectives
Support the development and completion of regular performance reporting and analysis that evidences progress against the Supporting Families objectives that informs strategic and operational decision-making
Lead on the completion of additional / ad-hoc reporting processes as dictated by central government, ensuring robust processes are in place to meet these requirements
Liaise with teams across the Council and partner agencies to improve data quality and identify other potential sources of data
Attend pan London SF data network meetings as required
Build successful relationships with a range of key stakeholders critical to the successful deliver of the programme, including service leads within Children’s Service and the wider council, DLUHC, partner agencies (inc.health and police) and voluntary organisations
To undertake any other work appropriate to the level and general nature of the post’s duties.
Where necessary for the job role or appropriate for continued development in the role, the post holder may be required to participate in training and development courses made available via the Council’s Apprentice Levy funding.
To undertake all duties with due regard to the provisions of health and safety regulations and legislation, Data Protection/GDPR, the Council’s Equal Opportunities and Customer Care policies.
To perform all duties in line with Council’s staff values showing commitment to improving residents lives and opportunities, demonstrating respect and fairness, taking ownership, working towards doing things better and working together across the council.
This post requires a Standard DBS and will be supported by Safer Recruitment tools
Excellent IT skills across a range of software applications including Advanced MS Excel, PowerBI (or similar) and standard office applications



Location: Woolwich

Hybrid: Yes


Salary: £19(PAYE) £24(Umbrella) p/hour

IR35 Status: Inside


Hours: 9.00-1700

Closing Date: 20.06.24

Duration: 6 months initially

Title: Graduate Data Analyst – London
Description:
Job Position: Data Graduate

Location: Central London

Starting Salary: £26,800

Requirements: Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM subject and experience in analysing data

Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Change and transformation for the world’s most ambitious organisations

Grayce partners with some of the world’s most ambitious organisations to help deliver change and transformation.

With over a decade’s experience developing and deploying high-performing talent for our FTSE 100 & 250 partners, our Accelerated Development Programme has enabled thousands of talented individuals to launch successful careers.

As a change and transformation consultancy, we offer a Business and Digital development pathway. On the Digital programme you could work in Data, DevOps, Software or a Hybrid role within these disciplines.

Join us and shape your future!  

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: Over the course of 4 years, you'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications (BCS foundations, CompTIA Cloud, Agile Practitioner), whilst getting hands-on experience working directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisationsn

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced coaches and Technical Trainers. They’ll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences

Community: Grayce doesn’t just talk about diversity and inclusion; we live and breathe it. Our community is built around an environment that values your unique perspective

What makes a great Grayce Analyst 

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: While having STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) background would be an advantage, we’re open to applicants from undergraduate backgrounds that have directly handled and manipulated data.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.  

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £26,800 with potential for significant growth in three years

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading alcohol brand team of a leading global media agency with a large and innovative range of research solutions, to get close to client’s business and communication strategy, to work at a regional and global level with multiple markets, to gain exposure to new data analytics techniques and to build experience across different industries.

As a Data Analyst that owns a market leading portfolio, and you’ll support the team to maintain and build dashboards and various reporting tools. You will support the delivery of reporting solutions and any data analytics project paying particular attention to data governance and to the clients’ requirements.

Our team makes a very significant contribution to our agency’s income through work delivered to our clients, and we support nearly every new business pitch. We also develop simple but original ways to help our account teams interrogate performance and industry data sets to quickly answer key client questions – enabling our mission of Better Decisions, Faster, improving the standard of work on our accounts and giving our agency and clients a competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Balancing all of these competing priorities has become a huge challenge and could hinder our future growth. We need an efficient and pro-active individual to join us. We need help to focus on the right places so that we can deliver our commercial targets and also support the wider agency development roadmap.

Requirements


Experience using Business Intelligence platforms such as Datorama, Tableau or Power BI.
Proven working knowledge of data quality and reporting solutions .
Comfortable working with large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
You will provide support on answering ad-hoc queries from clients and internal client hub teams – supporting quality and effectiveness across all stages.
You will have direct relationships with our clients, for example as you help us to manage the actions from the weekly client status meetings.
Knowledge of coding languages including SQL, Python are preferable.
Knowledge of Datorama and looker studio is desirable.


At OMD EMEA, we strive to deliver on our promise of ‘better decisions, faster‘ for our clients, partners and all 6,000+ OMDers across our region every day. As part of the world’s largest media network, our business is staging experiences for consumers who have more choice and less attention than ever before. The key to the process is empathy. Empathy to see the world through the eyes of the consumer, to recognise the needs of our clients and to identify aspirations of our talent.

Learn Fast, Act Fast. To help navigate the road to a ‘new normal’, learning from, and acting upon data signals at scale and speed is crucial. Visit Why OMD? to learn more about our unique Act Fast Framework.

Be Your Best

We want everyone to make the most of the opportunity to shine and showcase your talents and we are happy to make adjustments in the recruitment process so you can be your best. Please discuss any specific requirements with your dedicated Talent Team member or if you would feel more comfortable, you can email us confidentially at beyourbest@omnicommediagroup.com to let us know how we can support you.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at OMG

At OMG, our vision is to be an agency where difference is valued and everyone is able to thrive in a culture of equality, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to providing a truly inclusive environment that reflects today’s society, where everyone is able to bring their true selves to work, and where diverse voices and backgrounds are valued, heard, and well-represented.

We will process your personal data in accordance with our Recruitment Privacy Notice which is available on https://omnicommediagroup.com/recruitment-privacy-notices/.

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Who we are:




Apollo is an independent specialist (re)insurer launched in 2009 to provide high quality products and services to clients, brokers, and capital partners at Lloyd’s. The Apollo name recognised the success of one of its founding investors Neil Armstrong, who in 1969 was the first person to land on the moon. Along with Jim Hays, Neil saw the opportunity to build a differentiated service provider at Lloyd’s.




Today, Apollo is a team of more than 250 colleagues, servicing clients, partners, and brokers from across the globe through its unique augmented underwriting approach.




“We attract and retain the highest quality talent by developing a team atmosphere where opportunity exists for our employees and partners.” David Ibeson, Group CEO




Your Role:




Apollo is establishing a set of truly innovative data services to propel our business to the next level. We are capturing, transforming, and analysing a vast variety of data through a modern cloud-based data platform to produce fabulously rich insight for our business. However, we need an enthusiastic, skilful, and creative Data Insights Analyst to join the team to make this happen!




This role will be a key part of the Data Insights team by getting hands-on with our data and collaborating directly with teams across the business to deliver the information they need. You will need to bring the best of your data analysis skills to deliver this, either through designing repeatable reports or creating ad-hoc pieces of analysis and analytics projects.




By working directly with the business, you will be in the perfect place to listen to their thoughts and ideas and be able to bring them back into our wider data team. Here you will work with the rest of the Data Insights team as well as data engineers and other data specialists to drive the next versions of our data services.




The data space is ever evolving so there will also be lots of opportunity to gain experience, new skills and try innovative ways to analyse and visualise our information.




What you’ll do:




Work with colleges across Apollo under understand their requirements for data analysis and management information.
Contribute to the prioritisation of work within the team.
Work as part of an Agile delivery process to complete both BAU and project work within the Data Insights team
Use the team’s tools for work tracking and version control to make sure all finished work is supportable.
Develop reporting, analysis, and data visualisation solutions as part of a companywide MI portfolio.
Where requirements need wider data engineering and architecture support, document requirements and design information to be communicated into the wider team.
Challenge where requests for reporting and analysis go against our company data strategy or deviate from our data standards and processes.
Use your skills and data knowledge to coach, train, and support colleagues in the adoption of data analysis self-service.
Set expectations for and monitor data quality within reports and analysis, feeding back to the wider data function when anomalies are found.
Work within our data governance processes to implement common data definitions and best practices.
Understand how business processes can affect data quality via key source systems and help raise awareness to colleagues with data ownership responsibilities.
Keep our colleagues aware of the latest developments and capabilities in the Data Solutions, Data Insights, and wider data community.




What we are looking for:




Power BI report development including DAX.
Transact SQL and Python/Scala Scripting
Stakeholder management skills including requirements capture.
General analytical and modelling techniques
General data visualization and dashboard design techniques




What you will get in return:




As well as your salary, this role offers a discretionary bonus plus a broad range of benefits, including Non-Contributory Pension, Private Medical & Travel Insurance.




Our Commitment to Inclusion:




Apollo is a growing and diverse team of empowered and enthusiastic experts who focus on bringing innovation, data driven decision making and collaboration to every relationship and every risk. To meet the needs of a demanding global insurance market, we need a diverse workforce that understands the international communities we serve.




That is why we are focused on developing diverse talent at every level; inclusion and diversity means more to us than just chasing a target and we are committed to supporting and celebrating difference. Our people are at the heart of our business which is why we value the diversity of thought and talent of every member of our team.




We offer a range of support and run a programme of events and training that recognise the challenges and opportunities relating to diversity.




Hybrid & flexible working:




At Apollo, hybrid and flexible working is fully embraced and we do not see the benefit of presenteeism. We understand that no two colleagues are alike, and as such we support the ability to remain agile and achieve a home and work balance to best suit business and personal commitments.




Reasonable Adjustments:




We want everyone to have equal access to our recruitment and selection processes so please take a few moments to complete our Candidate profile to identify any support or adjustments you may require during the recruitment process https://cleartalents.com/apply/Apollo-tv1680005409/




Thank you!




To find out more about our values, ESG strategy and commitment to inclusion please click on the 'Life at Apollo Pack’ link at the bottom of our careers page https://apollounderwriting.com/careers/
